สมัคร 
บันทึกWorking with Us

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more careers.bms.com/working-with-us.

The Country Medical Lead is a trusted, agile partner who engages in influential dialogue, delivers timely, high impact data and insights that advance the science or accelerate access, and shapes medical practice to drive appropriate adoption of BMS medicines. The role requires a high level of independence, needs experience as a coach/mentor, and may act as medical representative when appropriate and necessary. The Country Medical Lead is expected to balance high customer focus with additional time in cross functional matrix collaborations, depending on local product lifecycle.

The SEA Medical Lead will be accountable for leading the South East Asia medical team and for providing a comprehensive and proactive medical service for supporting R&D, medical information, pharmacovigilance, market access and all relevant business functions as appropriate. The SEA Medical Lead will be a key member of the China and Asia Cluster Medical Leadership Team supporting the China Medical Lead, as well as facilitating the communication between the WW Medical Teams and the SEA medical team.


External Environment and Customer Focus
Role model in developing and maintaining peer-to-peer relationships and close contacts with Thought Leaders, appropriate HCPs, and access stakeholders, within a given geography to answer unsolicited product and HEOR related questions.
Master proficiency in available scientific resources and presentations. Effectively present information to HCPs, as appropriate, ensuring medical accuracy and compliance with local procedures, ethical and legal guidelines and directives.
Actively profile the medical and competitive landscape to effectively evolve planning at the market level within the medical team and matrix leadership teams, as appropriate.
Collect, analyze and present meaningful medical insights back to the medical and commercial organizations at brand team meetings to be actioned in support of the strategy development.
Design and Deliver the Medical Plan
Provide strategic guidance and input into the development of Brand plans and act as a role model in developing and executing the medical plan and related TL interaction plans. May contribute to regional / Worldwide medical plans, as appropriate.
Develop and deliver scientifically meaningful medical programs proposals and ensure flawless execution of medical activities to support overarching medical plan execution.
Discuss and deliver Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR) evidence based information (i.e., to government agencies, healthcare organizations, and payers), as appropriate.
Provide Medical Support
Supervise a field-based medical team with ensuring full external focus and priority on high-quality customer interactions
Lead cross functional collaboration within matrix teams to ensure appropriate embedding of the medical perspective and aligned focus in key critical execution to achieve overall medical strategies and objectives.
Represent medical as a key reference point for internal stakeholders and a regional reference for other SA’s (mentor or coach); demonstrate the ability to train SA’s by supporting with role play simulations and/or co-visits, while acting as a role model.
Facilitate continuous improvement towards higher quality work and promote innovation within the local team.
Lead the development of the medical / scientific sections of pricing and reimbursement files, if appropriate.
Support Clinical Trial Activities
Identify local needs and provide input into NIR strategy and IEP development, as appropriate.
Contribute to the “early prioritization” of development programs for the country by collating and integrating data on disease incidence / prevalence, treatment patterns, unmet medical needs and interest from the scientific community, as appropriate; Serve as point of reference for compounds in early development
Act as medical study director / study monitor and complete the designated training for these roles, if appropriate and in agreement with local medical management
Actively track study performance and contribute with insights and solutions
Ensure that BMS Pharmacovigilance procedural documents are understood and applied by Investigators of local studies, and alert appropriate BMS personnel to any identified Adverse Events.


Required Experience


Medical doctor (physician), PharmD or PhD, with experience in a specific Disease Area or with a broad medical background Or Science graduate with substantial and relevant pharmaceutical experience
Extensive knowledge and/or experience of healthcare and access environments
Extensive expertise in and knowledge of the medical organization
Demonstrated leadership of teams and working as a mentor
Excellent performance within the last 2 years;
For internal BMS candidates as calibrated by the organization OR
For external candidates as demonstrated through CV, first line manager interview of candidate, and reference feedback

Knowledge Desired


Therapeutic Area point of reference for internal/external stakeholders with superior disease Area knowledge and understanding scientific publications
Expert knowledge of relevant BMS scientific or clinical area
Expert knowledge of relevant BMS products highly desirable.
Expert in clinical trial design and drug development process (early and late)
Demonstrated track record of the above


Experience Desired


Market / Regional / WW initiative contribution which generated value to the organization
Alliance collaboration knowledge/exposure highly desirable
Industry association participation in cross company/industry initiatives for policy shaping
Business development search and evaluation experience


If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn’t perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.

Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers

With a single vision as inspiring as “Transforming patients’ lives through science™ ”, every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

On-site Protocol

Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is a necessary job function of this role, which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and it enhances the Company culture.

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. บันทึกABOUT US

TMZ Korea is an international cosmetics company based in Seoul, South Korea with offices in Vietnam, Singapore, and Japan as well. We are a team of young and highly entrepreneurial individuals come together as a powerhouse of creativity. We have set our sights on revolutionizing the beauty industry by exporting most trending Korean cosmetics to markets worldwide.




JOB TITLE: Overseas Sales Representative - Cosmetics and Personal Care




LOCATION: Based in Seoul, South Korea with the option to work remotely if you are located in target markets (Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Japan, or Taiwan)




LANGUAGE: Proficiency in English and Korean is highly preferred.




EXPERIENCE: Open to all levels of experience




EDUCATION: Minimum Bachelor's degree




JOB DESCRIPTION:

As an Overseas Sales Representative, you will be at the forefront of this expansion, engaging with both traditional retail channels and e-commerce platforms (Shopee and Amazon).




KEY RESPONSIBILITY:

Develop and execute sales strategies to increase brand visibility and sales in designated markets, particularly in Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Japan, and Taiwan.

Conduct market analysis to identify new opportunities and trends.
Collaborate with internal teams for product availability, marketing strategies, and customer satisfaction.
Regular travel to target markets for client engagement, trade shows, and market insights (if not based in one of the target countries).
Achieve and surpass sales targets to contribute to the company's expansion goals.




QUALIFICATION:

Proven sales experience in cosmetics, personal care, or a related field.
Strong understanding of the target markets in SEA and East Asia, with cultural knowledge of the specified countries being advantageous.
Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
Self-motivated and focused on results.
Capable of working independently and collaboratively.
Knowledge of e-commerce platforms such as Shopee and Amazon.

Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively. Can work independently and proactively, anticipating needs and taking initiative.

Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
Detail-oriented and adept at multitasking in a fast-paced environment.
Commitment to upholding strict confidentiality and maintaining a high level of professionalism.

Are you ready to be the driving force behind remarkable products that solve real-world challenges? Join us as a Product Owner and collaborate with clients and stakeholders to turn visions into successful reality!




At Criclabs, we are a young digital consultancy working with some of Asia’s fastest-growing startups. We design, develop and grow digital products across a wide range of industries, offering UX UI design, web development, SEO and other services to our clients. 




We celebrate individuals with passion, drive and determination. Join our vibrant, friendly team of digital experts at the heart of Bangkok to start your new journey today.




What You'll Do:

Team up with clients and stakeholders to deeply understand their needs and product visions.
Skillfully manage multiple projects, expertly handling the product roadmap for each one.

Master the art of prioritization, ensuring our efforts align with business goals, client aspirations, and market trends.
Be the ultimate support for our development team, ensuring they have everything they need to create exceptional products.
Embrace the agile spirit, actively participating in sprint planning, stand-ups, reviews, and retrospectives to achieve the perfect product vision.
Keep a keen eye on product performance, consistently seeking ways to elevate the user experience.
Be the storyteller for our clients and stakeholders, keeping them informed about progress, releases, and future plans.
Stay ahead of the curve with the latest trends, cutting-edge technologies, and product development best practices.




What We're Looking For:

A profound passion for crafting outstanding products that make a meaningful impact.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal - your ideas shine through.
Strong problem-solving abilities - you can conquer any challenge that comes your way.

What We Offer:

Education allowance
Flexible holiday leaves
Remote working budget
Bring-your-own-laptop bonus




If this opportunity excites you and you check all the boxes, send us your resume to join@criclabs.co. Let's collaborate and create extraordinary products together! 🚀

Financial Controller
Trane Technologies  กรุงเทพมหานคร

ดูบุคคลที่ Trane Technologies ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร
บันทึกThe Role

This position is responsible for managing the activities within Finance function in Thailand commercial of HVAC & Transport, API SBU. The position will report directly to the Finance Director of Emerging Market and Thailand territory and dual reports to Country Business Leader. This incumbent provides advice and counsel to the business leaders, and also provides business insight and functional guidance to the finance team in Thailand. Assuming the role of a business partner within the organization, to develop and enhance the finance organization capability to support business growth in Thailand.

Principal Responsibilities

· Provide leadership and financial expertise as a key member of the Thailand commercial leadership team to address and seek opportunities for continuing growth and margin expansion.

· Provide functional leadership to Thailand commercial finance organization. Build functional capability and excellence by creating a focused, team-oriented and effective group that adds value as business partners to the company. Participate actively in developing and integrating the strategic aims of the organization.

· Work closely with business leaders to provide needed financial counsel and support for decision making, and in-depth financial and operational analysis. Identify key business drivers impacting results. Where appropriate, develop action plans to improve performance.

· Lead annual AOP and LRP (long range planning) processes and provide accurate and meaningful financial information to the leadership team and provide interpretive, value-added guidance in addition to standard reporting and data compilation required for the business to achieve its financial objectives.

· Ensure that proper processes are in place for the accurate forecasting of sales, costs, working capital, fixed capital investments and return on investment.

· Ensure product costs are accurate and updated on a timely basis, new quotations and new products are priced properly, financial information is reported properly on a monthly basis and proper controls are in place and functioning to protect company assets.

· Oversee credit and collection initiatives to ensure that credit policies are enforced throughout the organization and that timely collections are made.

· Assume responsibility for improving process efficiency and implementing cost controls/programs within the organization.

· Ensure that corporate reporting requirements are met in a timely fashion and in accordance with Thailand, U.S. GAAP and other appropriate requirements, and that the business complies with components of Sarbanes-Oxley.

· Interface with external auditors to make certain that all statutory requirements are met and tax returns are filed in accordance with applicable laws and statutes

· Attract, hire, develop and retain an excellent financial team

· Support enterprise required Treasury, Tax and record to report on a regular basis.




Candidate Profile

In terms of the performance and personal competencies required for the position, we would highlight the following:

Bachelor's degree in business, accounting or finance from a four-year college or university. CMA, CPA, MBA all considered pluses.
Strong financial leader in a multinational company, ideally with 10+ years of relevant exposure including progressive, demonstrated cost management / accounting and financial control experience and technical capability.
Solid understanding of IT and other business systems (MRP/ERP) in terms of leveraging these systems to enhance functional efficiencies.
Capability to manage risk and change, combined with hands-on experience in dealing with an unsettling economic environment in terms of being able to adapt and execute operational strategies accordingly.
Strong people management skills with the ability to earn the respect and trust of peers, seniors and subordinates, so as to win their support and cooperation.
Proper perspective and level of maturity in engaging with and using statutory and internal auditors to drive improvements in processes & control environments while preserving governance standards.
Understanding of and proficiency in Thailand, US GAAP and international accounting standards, and good comprehension of Sarbanes-Oxley.
Fluency in English is required.

สมัคร
บันทึกCompany Description

The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.

We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.

We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.

Job Description


To develop sales in an efficient and effective way in all media in order to attract more customers to our IKEA store.
To lead and inspire your team, other functions and the store to achieve maximum sales growth and profit-ability.
Contribute to the business development regionally using your specialist sales knowledge.
Ensure the store is in excellent shape as new and fully and efficiently stocked with the four merchandising basics in place at all times and that the IKEA product range is presented in ways that inspire and satisfy customers.
Ensure your team has all the correct knowledge about the product range in your department and the IKEA services so that they can share this with IKEA customers to improve their overall shopping experience.
Understand the different IKEA sales and communication channels and IKEA know-how in order to make the best commercial use of this information for different customers.
Take responsibility for your department goals and secure that your action plan ensures the country priorities for your Home Furnishing Business (HFB) are implemented in your store.
You and your team actively sales steer to your department’s top-selling products, prioritised products (e.g. overstock/övertag) and IKEA service products in order to maximise sales and long-term profitability.
You ensure the team have the right number of co-workers in the right place at the right time to ensure your co-workers are ready and available to meet our customers.


Qualifications

No specific & as long have relevant Sales Experience

Additional Information

Please apply by 6 January 2023

E-commerce's Governance and Experience (GNE) is a global team responsible for ensuring our marketplace is safe and trustworthy for not only our users, but also sellers and creators. We value user satisfaction and work on policies, rules and systems to ensure quality. Service and Experience Team (SET) is part of the GNE organization. Our mission is to provide world-class service and experience for customers, sellers and creators. SET is looking for a Tier 2 Service Specialist role who is responsible for handling escalations and complex cases within the Customer/Seller/Creator Service team.

Roles & Responsibilities
- Manage customer/seller/creator enquiries escalated by Tier 1 teams in CRM tool.
- Identify root cause of escalated issues and provide appropriate resolutions in order to deliver excellent service. Summarize the Q&A and log in to the knowledge management tool.
- Promptly escalate critical/ high-risk cases to the appropriate authority.
- Coordinate with other teams/ departments to resolve customer issues, follow-up and make sure close-loop to all escalations.
- Look for opportunities to identify ongoing issues and eliminate repeat complaints, reduce escalation rate in order to enhance operating process and improve overall customer experience.
- Respond to internal and external customer escalations quickly, proficiently and professionally while meeting specific quality expectations.
- Adhere to established procedures and guidelines while providing quality customer service in order to meet and exceed department standards.
- Engage sellers to develop long-term relationships and confidence in TikTok E-commerce.
- Promptly escalate critical/ high-risk cases to the appropriate authority.
- Look for opportunities to identify on-going issues and eliminate repeat complaints, reduce escalation rate in order to enhance operating process and improve overall customer experience.
- Support ad-hoc projects and initiatives per business needs.

Qualifications

- BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
- Requires a minimum of 2 years' experience in a customer service environment.
- Demonstrates effective, clear and professional written and oral communication.
- Eager to learn, initiative taker and problem-solver.
- Proactive and continuous improvement attitude.
- High problem solving and priority skills.
- Thrives in fast and dynamic environments.
- Ability to work under high pressure.
- Support business in shifts by following the local labor laws.
- Meticulous and organized.
- Have a good temper to handle disputes and emergencies.
- Must be customer service and result-oriented.
- Excellent skills for communicating and relating with both team members and customers.
- Experience in eCommerce or marketplace platforms is a plus.
- Works comfortably with Microsoft Word and Excel.
- Good written and verbal communication skills in English & Thai.

UDPS Director
UD Trucks  ปากน้ำ

สมัคร 
บันทึกUDPS Director

Department : Operations Bangkok (BP50000)

Job Overview

UD Trucks is known for our pioneering technologies and products within the commercial automotive industry. UDPS Director will leads and drive the implementation of improvement activity. Support and secure the effectiveness of UDPS system. Manage all resources under responsibility to achieve required targets efficiently.

Responsibilities And Duties


Plan and organize the yearly UDPS activities and align with stakeholders
Measure & follow business KPI for UDPS implementation progress and result
Deliver the coaching, networking, and training actions that support the agreed UDPS roadmap which align to UDT /UD Trucks Operations Strategic Direction Short Term /Mid Term Plan
Leading Strategic Alignment / Workshop and Drive/Lead for result of Strategic Priorities and Key Activities to secure all deliverable to meet time plan /Secure Control Tower keep living process.
Challenge the management and Boost UDPS best practices within the operation to accelerate efficiency and to reach operational excellence throughout the organization


Lead and implementation of UDPS tools and module under UDPS area


Forecast and plan budget need for UDPS
Plan and provide the necessary training relate to UDPS for concern functions
Be the Owner for the Focused Improvement competence area
Be the Expert for the Management Commitment competence area and support to drive Change Management together with UDTO BKK Management Team
Support and maintain in the responsible area to comply with safety & environment requirements and legislation including ensuring for continually improvement
Support MFG Cost Reduction activities using Focused Improvement competence area methodology
Plan and support UDTO Bangkok People development program thru Manufacturing Academy
Secure/ Manage ISO Management System Audits, Document Reviews etc. are compliance


Preferred Educational And/or Training Qualifications And Certificates


Bachelor’s degree or Master degree in Industrial or related field Preferred experience and knowledge
Require experience on automotive business or related field 7 years minimum or experience in managerial level 2 years minimum
Managerial experience with strong managerial skill with high leadership skill
Good communication, presentation and facilitation skills.


Necessary Technical/functional/language Skills


He/she is able to demonstrate a clear vision, global mind set and he/she is successful in people development and culture leadership.
The individual is highly skilled in coaching and facilitation as well as having a good understanding of interpersonal relations and organizational development.
He/she is a strong communicant with good influencing skills, also able to create trustful relations in spite of cultural differences and geographical distance
Demonstrating a high and solid level in each of the Volvo Group Leadership competencies for the leading leader’s level, this individual will be an inspiring and inclusive leader as well as an active team worker.
Significant change management experience and demonstrated ability to set demanding targets and to motivate teams and individuals to deliver outside their comfort zones, whilst further developing an excellent working climate and atmosphere in alignment with the Volvo 5 Value and the Code of Conduct.
Proficiency in the English language is required, other languages are beneficial
Having a good understanding of UD Trucks Business


About UD Trucks

Part of the Isuzu group, UD Trucks is a global leading international commercial vehicle solutions provider headquartered in Japan. At UD Trucks, we are defining the next generation of smart logistics solutions through advanced innovations in automation, electro mobility and connectivity. UD Trucks develops, manufactures and sells a wide range of heavy, medium and light-duty trucks, operating in more than 60 countries across all continents. Our trucks and people go the extra mile for our customers and business partners, day in and day out.

We are an 8,000+ strong team of colleagues with 40 nationalities who bring diversity and passion in delivering our products and services. We trust each other, work collaboratively and embrace change. At UD Trucks, our purpose is Better Life – to make life better for people and the planet. We have developed a culture that promotes:

Diverse and friendly culture – Strong culture of diversity and inclusion, organizing annual events, daily activities and open communication platforms including various internal voluntary networks.

Empowered growth – Global exposure and growth opportunities across functions and countries through internal mobility system and self-driven career opportunities, building a learning organization by enabling self-managed learning supported by the UD Academy.

Flexibility with trust – We continue to fully support both remote working (where and when applicable) and flexible working hours, we actively encourage our colleagues to maintain a good work/life balance. You will have the autonomy and flexibility to split your working time between both our wonderful, modern and equipped HQ and remotely.

Be part of our journey to create Better Life for society, for our customers and for yourself. UD Trucks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues.

บันทึกResponsibilities


Manages a broad range of moderately complex supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis and planning, demand management, logistics management, and import/export operations typically with a large or complex global business unit.
Identifies opportunities for process improvement and develops recommendations.
Independently executes the demand and supply matching activities, connecting planning to execution, and identifying issues and their impact.
Drives backlog management.
Gathers demand data from country, region and account managers to synthesize information using complex analyses, and delivers demand signals to the supply base to contribute to demand forecasting.
Coordinates or leads regional and global business unit planning teams to maintain and enhance the current business processes.
Reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement.
Contributes to priority projects with complex analyses and assists in developing recommendations.
Communicates requirements and guidelines to the regional and global business unit planning teams.
Coordinates, develops, and manages a Regulatory Trade Compliance program.


Education And Experience Required


First level university degree or equivalent experience; may have advanced university degree.
Typically 4-6 years of experience in a supply chain function.


Knowledge And Skills


Strong understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).
Very strong analytical and data modeling skills.
Very Strong communication and influencing skills; mastery in English and local language.
Proven relationship management skills.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Strong project management skills to lead cross-functional teams; recognized as Subject Matter Expert.
Strong business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong Understanding of HP's overall supply chain strategy.
Extensive understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP), Available to Promise (ATP) and master scheduling.
Good understanding of national and international trade requirements to align customs/trade function with business objectives.
Thorough knowledge of inventory analysis.


About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Bring the Elephant Home Foundation  ประเทศไทย
3 ชั่วโมงก่อน   มาเป็นหนึ่งในผู้สมัคร 25 คนแรก
  
ดูบุคคลที่ Bring the Elephant Home Foundation ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร
บันทึกส่งข้อความโดยตรงถึงผู้ประกาศรับสมัครงานจาก Bring the Elephant Home Foundation

Antoinette Van de Water, PhD
Antoinette Van de Water, PhD
Elephant conservation, research and policy development

Operations Manager

Bring The Elephant Home

For a world where elephants and people can thrive




                                                                                                                          

Organization:  Foundation Bring The Elephant Home

Start date: January 15, 2024  

Position: Part-time, 3 days a week

Contract: 1 year (3 months probation, opportunity to extend) 

Based in: Remote - one visit at the end of each month to Ruam Thai 

Kui Buri, Prachuap Khiri Khan. 




 

Introduction Bring The Elephant Home

 

Bring The Elephant Home is dedicated to ensuring the well-being and survival of Asian elephants, fostering socio-ecological resilience, and striving for a world where both elephants and people can thrive. Our community-based conservation approach, developed over a decade, emphasizes shared decision-making, sustainability, equality, and partnerships. Through our projects, we promote human-elephant coexistence by supporting farmers in elephant-friendly livelihoods and land use, contributing to meaningful coexistence between elephants and people. 




Your Role




As the Operations Manager, you will play a crucial role in the development of our organization. 

Your responsibilities include:




Financial Management:




Monitor the foundation's financial health, ensuring adherence to financial policies and procedures.
Prepare and analyze monthly reports on budgets and funds utilization, providing insights into financial performance.
Assist in creating annual financial reports and forecasting activities, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements.
Co-manage Bring The Elephant Home’s online accounting platforms, Xero and Xero Expenses, to ensure accurate financial records.
Collaborate with the accountants and BTEH’s field staff to input monthly financial data into Xero and work with them to auto-generate reports for both internal use and funders.
Coordinate fund requests to Bring The Elephant Home Netherlands and submit necessary financial reports.




HR Management:




Oversee the administrative onboarding process for new staff by registering their profiles on our payroll and other organizational platforms.
Manage monthly payroll registration information.
Prepare, save, and print staff pay slips for submission to the accounting office monthly.
Coordinate WHT (PND.53) e-filing and send certificates to the payroll office.
Handle administrative aspects of employee relations, including raises, corrective actions, employment agreements, vacation leave, reimbursement requests, employee manuals, benefits administration, and any other legal matters related to their employment with Bring The Elephant Home.




Legal Management:




Manage a small group of international staff members’ visas and work permits.
Manage Ruam Thai office registration, lease agreements, and other legal documentation.




 

Your qualifications

 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, accounting, human resources, finance or related field.
Proven experience in general management, financial oversight, budgeting, forecasting, and expertise in Xero or a similar online accounting system.
Familiarity with HR management, including onboarding, employee relations, and HR coordination skills.
Familiarity with legal processes involved with applying for, visas and work permits, and managing contracts with third-party individuals, such as lease agreements.
Proficient in Google Sheets/Excel, Xero or equivalent programs for operational tasks.
Strong analytical and decision-making skills in dynamic environments. Experience in creating management reports, including data visualization.
Thai resident with fluency in Thai and English.




 

How to Apply

Please send your resume and cover letter to ave@bteh.org and support@bteh.org before December 20, 2023. Be sure to include "Operations Manager Application" in the subject line. We look forward to reviewing your application.




Bring The Elephant Home is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, inclusion, and equality. We celebrate the range of diversity, culture, and unique differences within our organization and network. We embrace inclusiveness by encouraging everyone to share their ideas, opinions and knowledge, and we welcome diversity at all levels. Furthermore, inclusion enables out-of-the-box solutions, makes sustainable growth possible, increases resilience, and is essential to creating a just and sustainable world. Bring The Elephant Home is officially registered as a non-profit organization in Thailand.

GQ Apparel is the innovator of tech apparel in Thailand. As the leading omnichannel brand in the country, we blend innovative technology with contemporary designs to offer wearable solutions that seamlessly fit into everyday life. We're not just setting trends; we're revolutionizing the way people perceive and wear apparel.




Position Overview:

As the Merchandising Manager at GQ Apparel Thailand, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our product assortment is both innovative and commercially viable. You will be at the crossroads of fashion, technology, and business, driving sales while keeping our product offerings fresh and aligned with the brand's vision.

Product Strategy: Develop and implement merchandising strategies to ensure product assortment meets market demands and financial objectives.




Trend Analysis: Stay updated with fashion and tech trends, ensuring GQ Apparel remains at the forefront of the industry.




Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels, ensuring optimal stock levels that support sales targets without resulting in overstock situations.




Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with the design, marketing, inventory, and sales teams to ensure a seamless flow from product conceptualization to customer purchase.




Reporting: Regularly analyze sales data, providing insights and recommendations to optimize future product assortments.

Minimum of 5 years experience in merchandising, preferably within the apparel sector.

Strong analytical, negotiation, and communication skills.

An eye for detail, coupled with a strategic mindset.

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously.

Familiarity with the Thai market and its consumer preferences.







What We Offer:

Join Us:

If you have the passion, expertise, and vision to elevate GQ Apparel Thailand to even greater heights, we want to hear from you. Be a part of our journey as we redefine the boundaries of fashion and technology in the apparel industry.

Experience applying machine learning and statistical methods to large datasets

Excellent command of English in both verbal and written forms

SEA Medical Lead
Bristol Myers Squibb  กรุงเทพมหานคร
17 ชั่วโมงก่อน   มาเป็นหนึ่งในผู้สมัคร 25 คนแรก
  
ดูบุคคลที่ Bristol Myers Squibb ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร 
บันทึกWorking with Us

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more careers.bms.com/working-with-us.

The Country Medical Lead is a trusted, agile partner who engages in influential dialogue, delivers timely, high impact data and insights that advance the science or accelerate access, and shapes medical practice to drive appropriate adoption of BMS medicines. The role requires a high level of independence, needs experience as a coach/mentor, and may act as medical representative when appropriate and necessary. The Country Medical Lead is expected to balance high customer focus with additional time in cross functional matrix collaborations, depending on local product lifecycle.

The SEA Medical Lead will be accountable for leading the South East Asia medical team and for providing a comprehensive and proactive medical service for supporting R&D, medical information, pharmacovigilance, market access and all relevant business functions as appropriate. The SEA Medical Lead will be a key member of the China and Asia Cluster Medical Leadership Team supporting the China Medical Lead, as well as facilitating the communication between the WW Medical Teams and the SEA medical team.


External Environment and Customer Focus
Role model in developing and maintaining peer-to-peer relationships and close contacts with Thought Leaders, appropriate HCPs, and access stakeholders, within a given geography to answer unsolicited product and HEOR related questions.
Master proficiency in available scientific resources and presentations. Effectively present information to HCPs, as appropriate, ensuring medical accuracy and compliance with local procedures, ethical and legal guidelines and directives.
Actively profile the medical and competitive landscape to effectively evolve planning at the market level within the medical team and matrix leadership teams, as appropriate.
Collect, analyze and present meaningful medical insights back to the medical and commercial organizations at brand team meetings to be actioned in support of the strategy development.
Design and Deliver the Medical Plan
Provide strategic guidance and input into the development of Brand plans and act as a role model in developing and executing the medical plan and related TL interaction plans. May contribute to regional / Worldwide medical plans, as appropriate.
Develop and deliver scientifically meaningful medical programs proposals and ensure flawless execution of medical activities to support overarching medical plan execution.
Discuss and deliver Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR) evidence based information (i.e., to government agencies, healthcare organizations, and payers), as appropriate.
Provide Medical Support
Supervise a field-based medical team with ensuring full external focus and priority on high-quality customer interactions
Lead cross functional collaboration within matrix teams to ensure appropriate embedding of the medical perspective and aligned focus in key critical execution to achieve overall medical strategies and objectives.
Represent medical as a key reference point for internal stakeholders and a regional reference for other SA’s (mentor or coach); demonstrate the ability to train SA’s by supporting with role play simulations and/or co-visits, while acting as a role model.
Facilitate continuous improvement towards higher quality work and promote innovation within the local team.
Lead the development of the medical / scientific sections of pricing and reimbursement files, if appropriate.
Support Clinical Trial Activities
Identify local needs and provide input into NIR strategy and IEP development, as appropriate.
Contribute to the “early prioritization” of development programs for the country by collating and integrating data on disease incidence / prevalence, treatment patterns, unmet medical needs and interest from the scientific community, as appropriate; Serve as point of reference for compounds in early development
Act as medical study director / study monitor and complete the designated training for these roles, if appropriate and in agreement with local medical management
Actively track study performance and contribute with insights and solutions
Ensure that BMS Pharmacovigilance procedural documents are understood and applied by Investigators of local studies, and alert appropriate BMS personnel to any identified Adverse Events.


Required Experience


Medical doctor (physician), PharmD or PhD, with experience in a specific Disease Area or with a broad medical background Or Science graduate with substantial and relevant pharmaceutical experience
Extensive knowledge and/or experience of healthcare and access environments
Extensive expertise in and knowledge of the medical organization
Demonstrated leadership of teams and working as a mentor
Excellent performance within the last 2 years;
For internal BMS candidates as calibrated by the organization OR
For external candidates as demonstrated through CV, first line manager interview of candidate, and reference feedback

Knowledge Desired


Therapeutic Area point of reference for internal/external stakeholders with superior disease Area knowledge and understanding scientific publications
Expert knowledge of relevant BMS scientific or clinical area
Expert knowledge of relevant BMS products highly desirable.
Expert in clinical trial design and drug development process (early and late)
Demonstrated track record of the above


Experience Desired


Market / Regional / WW initiative contribution which generated value to the organization
Alliance collaboration knowledge/exposure highly desirable
Industry association participation in cross company/industry initiatives for policy shaping
Business development search and evaluation experience


If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn’t perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.

Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers

With a single vision as inspiring as “Transforming patients’ lives through science™ ”, every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

On-site Protocol

Physical presence at the BMS worksite or physical presence in the field is a necessary job function of this role, which the Company deems critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, employee well-being and engagement, and it enhances the Company culture.

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com. Visit careers.bms.com/eeo-accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.

Any data processed in connection with role applications will be treated in accordance with applicable data privacy policies and regulations.

บันทึกABOUT US

TMZ Korea is an international cosmetics company based in Seoul, South Korea with offices in Vietnam, Singapore, and Japan as well. We are a team of young and highly entrepreneurial individuals come together as a powerhouse of creativity. We have set our sights on revolutionizing the beauty industry by exporting most trending Korean cosmetics to markets worldwide.




JOB TITLE: Overseas Sales Representative - Cosmetics and Personal Care




LOCATION: Based in Seoul, South Korea with the option to work remotely if you are located in target markets (Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Japan, or Taiwan)




LANGUAGE: Proficiency in English and Korean is highly preferred.




EXPERIENCE: Open to all levels of experience




EDUCATION: Minimum Bachelor's degree




JOB DESCRIPTION:

As an Overseas Sales Representative, you will be at the forefront of this expansion, engaging with both traditional retail channels and e-commerce platforms (Shopee and Amazon).




KEY RESPONSIBILITY:

Develop and execute sales strategies to increase brand visibility and sales in designated markets, particularly in Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Japan, and Taiwan.
Establish and maintain robust relationships with clients, distributors, and partners across these regions.
Conduct market analysis to identify new opportunities and trends.
Collaborate with internal teams for product availability, marketing strategies, and customer satisfaction.
Regular travel to target markets for client engagement, trade shows, and market insights (if not based in one of the target countries).
Achieve and surpass sales targets to contribute to the company's expansion goals.




QUALIFICATION:

Proven sales experience in cosmetics, personal care, or a related field.
Strong understanding of the target markets in SEA and East Asia, with cultural knowledge of the specified countries being advantageous.
Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
Self-motivated and focused on results.
Capable of working independently and collaboratively.
Knowledge of e-commerce platforms such as Shopee and Amazon.

สมัคร
บันทึกAbout us

The Discova brand was launched in July 2019 and is the newest brand in the Flight Centre Travel Group family of brands. The merger of Buffalo Tours in Asia and Olympus Tours in the Americas created a global DMC business with more than 20 years experience in delivering amazing travel experiences to our customers. With a purpose to connect people and places with a world of possibilities, we are the travel people who work globally, live locally and go the extra mile to help our partners extend their reach.




About the Opportunity

As a member of the Operations team, the Operations Executive plays a key role to ensure that Discova meets and exceed its goals and operates successfully. The Operations Executive will work in partnership with Operations Team Leader to execute the operational standards and requirements that will drive the customer satisfaction and productivity. This will involve the delivery of best-in-class service and memorable local experiences for the customer.




Your main responsibilities are:

Book and operate tours with accuracy within budget.
Consistently follow Discova One-Best-Ways (OBWs) processes/procedures/systems across the accounts handled.
Make sure to keep strong relationships with suppliers.
Effectively cooperate with Tour Guides, Product, Sales, Reservation, Customer Experience and Suppliers for seamless daily operations and overall service improvements
Solve on the ground situations with initiative within agreed process.
Be customer oriented and help improve satisfaction as well as Net Promoter Score.




About you

The Essentials:

A bachelor's degree or a degree in tourism and hospitality is an advantage.
Experience in a DMC or tour operator is an advantage.
Good command of both written and spoken English.
An understanding and belief in Responsible Tourism is desirable.




The Attributes:

Excellent organisational skills with the ability to be flexible and implementing change when needed.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal across a variety of cultures to a diverse range of people (customers, suppliers, team members, leaders).
Highly motivated, self-starter prepared to do whatever it takes to succeed
High attention to detail.
Able to work under pressure and juggle multiple tasks and able to work outside office hours when required.
Solution focused and great at problem solving.
Able to work independently and within a team assisting team members to help everyone achieve results.
Personally aligned with Discova’s company purpose and values.

Finally, if you are successful, you will find out that working with Discova is more than just a job. To be part of the Discova family is to be in your element. We offer an exciting career progression globally and a fantastic and supportive team culture and social events that are the envy of the industry. Get in touch now and Discova a world of possibilities!




We value our team at Discova and promise an environment of equality, respect, and growth. We're an equal-opportunity employer and prioritize accessibility in our hiring process. Contact our Recruitment Team for accommodation requests at recruitment@discova.com. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

สมัคร
บันทึกAbout the Team

PwC SEAC’s Digital Transformation practice provides a combination of business and technology advice from strategy to execution and helps solve our clients’ most complex business challenges in today’s interlinked and global environment.




The Financial Services Productivity team enables banking institutions, asset managers, insurance companies and others to accelerate the digital change in their operations and business processes and future proofing their operational readiness by running current state assessments with advanced analytics, redesigning operating models, coaching new ways of working and managing change initiatives and technology implementations.




We work closely together with our own innovation centers, the big technology firms and Fintechs to bring the best solutions to our clients. It is our goal to support our clients to achieve sustained growth, increased operational efficiency to increase their competitive advantage, as well as to ensure that operational systems are agile and responsive to a constantly changing environment and highly complex ecosystem.




Our focus areas are Digital Operations and Ecosystems, Productivity Improvement & Transformation.




About the Role

You will work with our clients and our internal cross line of service teams to:

Lead and deliver client engagements and collaborate with senior management, their teams and our internal cross line of service teams to design strategies and target operating models and to deliver large-scale transformation projects, which helps to address our clients’ evolving needs in their business divisions and supporting functions along the dimensions of visioning, insight, efficiency and effectiveness, and control
Identify initiatives to help clients to transform / improve their organization and operations in areas such as Client Onboarding, Payments and Settlement, Products and Services, Client Life Cycle Management, Advisory Models, Risk and Compliance processes & controls, Consolidation initiatives, Management Reporting, Restructuring
Advice our clients’ senior management on how to accelerate change and to design thought leadership based on market analysis, market trends and customer needs and by identifying market opportunities for our clients, outlining what financial services firms have to change to achieve their goals
Develop deep relationships with key leaders management executives from clients and support our leaders to bring the range of Digital Transformation, Growth strategies, Productivity and other competency offerings to the client




About you

You are likely a good fit with the following key attributes:

Degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Business Engineering related discipline from a reputable University, with strong skills and experience in financial services.
Required skills: financial management, business development, client management, consulting industry experience
Minimum 8 years of relevant experience, ideally in Consulting, with demonstrated skills in building pipeline, managing projects and communicating effectively with clients and teams; Financial Service industry experience or internal consulting role is preferred.
Strong story boarding, business case development, analytical and problem-solving skills
Experienced project manager capable of working independently with both internal stakeholders and clients
Demonstrate a profound understanding of the banking or financial services industry, incl. products and regulations
Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills with a track record of senior executive level engagement
Can speak and write Thai and English language.

Company Description

Progressus Asia is a talent development organization committed to having a positive impact on professionals and businesses operating in the livestock, poultry, and aquaculture industries in the Asia-Pacific region and beyond. The organization offers a unique package of services, including agri-tech courses, talent development training and workshops, and event organization and management. Progressus Asia is passionate, focused, and has an extensive industry network, making it the goto organization for aspiring professionals.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for an Event Manager located in Bangkok. The Event Manager will be responsible for planning, organizing, and coordinating various agribusiness events in the Asia-Pacific region, collaborating with organizations to launch products, build brands, strengthen relations, create demand, and align with target audiences. The Event Manager will also be responsible for developing, managing, and monitoring event budgets and timelines.




Qualifications

สมัคร
บันทึกProfile: Local Companies, Institutions, Organisations, etc., or Private Consultants

Location: Thailand




NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields. With more than 1.100 international projects and studies already completed, and 16 project offices around the world, we have established ourselves as a leading consulting company. With the expansion of international activities and clients, NTU’s project pipeline and opportunities have grown significantly, therefore, we are looking for a motivated and result oriented individual and/or company, institution or organisation, who is interested in experiencing being part of our international success.







NTU is leading a consortium for the EU SIEA 2023 LOT 4 – Sustainable Transport, Infrastructures, Green Cities, Connectivity and Sustainable Mobility and we are looking to expand our network with skilled local partners from the target countries.







The relevant sectors for this project are the following:




Sustainable Transport and Infrastructure
Urban Development and Cities
Rural Infrastructure







We invite interested Private Consultants and Local Companies, Institutions, Organisations, etc. to confirm their interest by submitting a short application for our Local Partner Network in your region.

If you are interested in this position, please apply and upload your profile with information on:

Name of local partner
Country of registration
Country(ies) where the entity is operating
Short description of the organisation you represent

Please also make sure that you include one or more telephone numbers and an email which we may use to get in contact with you.

NTU will register your interest and should there be a specific opportunity in the country of your operation we will contact you with specific details.

We encourage all applicants to follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ntu-international/

Please note that this will be an ongoing contract and Local Partners will be contacted accordingly to the assignment in which their expertise lies within.




Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Drives backlog management.

Coordinates or leads regional and global business unit planning teams to maintain and enhance the current business processes.
Reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement.

Communicates requirements and guidelines to the regional and global business unit planning teams.
Coordinates, develops, and manages a Regulatory Trade Compliance program.


Education And Experience Required

Knowledge And Skills


Strong understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).
Very strong analytical and data modeling skills.
Very Strong communication and influencing skills; mastery in English and local language.
Proven relationship management skills.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Strong project management skills to lead cross-functional teams; recognized as Subject Matter Expert.
Strong business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong Understanding of HP's overall supply chain strategy.
Extensive understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP), Available to Promise (ATP) and master scheduling.
Good understanding of national and international trade requirements to align customs/trade function with business objectives.
Thorough knowledge of inventory analysis.


About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

สมัคร 
บันทึกPOSITION OVERVIEW:

We are seeking a visionary and results-driven Engineering Director to lead our engineering efforts within the manufacturing technology sector. As an Engineering Director, you will play a pivotal role in defining and executing our technology strategy for optimizing manufacturing processes, driving operational excellence, and delivering innovative solutions. Your expertise in engineering, coupled with your strong leadership skills, will be crucial in aligning cross-functional teams, shaping the technology roadmap, and ensuring the successful implementation of projects that revolutionize our manufacturing capabilities.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Lead and oversee a diverse team of skilled engineers and technical professionals, providing strategic direction, mentorship, and guidance to drive high performance, innovation, and career growth.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional leaders in manufacturing, operations, and R&D to define technology roadmaps that align with business objectives and drive continuous improvements across manufacturing processes.
Develop and execute a comprehensive technology strategy that encompasses a wide range of capabilities and digital transformation initiatives within the manufacturing domain.
Drive the end-to-end product development lifecycle, from ideation and design to implementation, testing, and deployment of technology-driven manufacturing solutions.
Ensure solutions are released with adequate observability and troubleshooting mechanics in place. Define service level agreements, indicators and objectives. Select metrics and thresholds to detect anomalies in system operation.
Accountable to production incidents using structured analysis and fact-based observations. Implement temporary and permanent solutions to restore service levels within agreed SLA timelines. Communicate progress clearly, escalate when needed.
Foster a culture of collaboration and innovation, encouraging teams to explore new technologies, methodologies, and processes that enhance manufacturing efficiency, product quality, and operational excellence.
Harness the power of data analytics and real-time monitoring to optimize manufacturing workflows, predict maintenance needs, and drive continuous process improvement in corporation with Data & Analytics function
Monitor project progress and performance, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and in line with quality standards. Identify risks and proactively implement mitigation strategies.
Stay informed about industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in manufacturing engineering, leveraging this knowledge to drive continuous improvement and innovation.
Act as a strategic partner to executive leadership, providing insights into technology trends, potential business opportunities, and challenges within the manufacturing technology landscape.



QUALIFICATIONS:


Proven experience (5 years+) of Technology in Manufacturing environment including Cloud, Manufacturing Execution System.
Agile & DevOps experience and ambition for the role and team.
Technical/Engineering expertise with API’s, CI/CD and Observability tooling.
Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams through the implementation of technology-driven manufacturing solutions that result in operational efficiencies and improved product quality.
In-depth knowledge of Industry 4.0 principles and practices, with a focus on leveraging digital technologies to transform traditional manufacturing processes.
Experience with smart manufacturing platforms, digital twin technologies, and real-time process optimization.
Strong familiarity with cloud computing, edge computing, and cybersecurity considerations in manufacturing technology implementations.
Proven ability to collaborate with external partners, vendors, and research institutions to stay at the forefront of technological advancements in manufacturing.
Prior experience in technology leadership roles within manufacturing organizations, guiding large-scale technology transformation initiatives.

Operations Manager
Bring the Elephant Home Foundation  ประเทศไทย
3 ชั่วโมงก่อน   มาเป็นหนึ่งในผู้สมัคร 25 คนแรก
  
ดูบุคคลที่ Bring the Elephant Home Foundation ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร
บันทึกส่งข้อความโดยตรงถึงผู้ประกาศรับสมัครงานจาก Bring the Elephant Home Foundation

Antoinette Van de Water, PhD
Antoinette Van de Water, PhD
Elephant conservation, research and policy development

Operations Manager

Bring The Elephant Home

For a world where elephants and people can thrive




                                                                                                                          

Organization:  Foundation Bring The Elephant Home

Start date: January 15, 2024  

Position: Part-time, 3 days a week

Contract: 1 year (3 months probation, opportunity to extend) 

Based in: Remote - one visit at the end of each month to Ruam Thai 

Kui Buri, Prachuap Khiri Khan. 




 

Introduction Bring The Elephant Home

 

Bring The Elephant Home is dedicated to ensuring the well-being and survival of Asian elephants, fostering socio-ecological resilience, and striving for a world where both elephants and people can thrive. Our community-based conservation approach, developed over a decade, emphasizes shared decision-making, sustainability, equality, and partnerships. Through our projects, we promote human-elephant coexistence by supporting farmers in elephant-friendly livelihoods and land use, contributing to meaningful coexistence between elephants and people. 




Your Role




As the Operations Manager, you will play a crucial role in the development of our organization. 

Your responsibilities include:




Financial Management:




Monitor the foundation's financial health, ensuring adherence to financial policies and procedures.
Prepare and analyze monthly reports on budgets and funds utilization, providing insights into financial performance.
Assist in creating annual financial reports and forecasting activities, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements.
Co-manage Bring The Elephant Home’s online accounting platforms, Xero and Xero Expenses, to ensure accurate financial records.
Collaborate with the accountants and BTEH’s field staff to input monthly financial data into Xero and work with them to auto-generate reports for both internal use and funders.
Coordinate fund requests to Bring The Elephant Home Netherlands and submit necessary financial reports.




HR Management:




Oversee the administrative onboarding process for new staff by registering their profiles on our payroll and other organizational platforms.
Manage monthly payroll registration information.
Prepare, save, and print staff pay slips for submission to the accounting office monthly.
Coordinate WHT (PND.53) e-filing and send certificates to the payroll office.
Handle administrative aspects of employee relations, including raises, corrective actions, employment agreements, vacation leave, reimbursement requests, employee manuals, benefits administration, and any other legal matters related to their employment with Bring The Elephant Home.




Legal Management:




Manage a small group of international staff members’ visas and work permits.
Manage Ruam Thai office registration, lease agreements, and other legal documentation.




 

Your qualifications

 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, accounting, human resources, finance or related field.
Proven experience in general management, financial oversight, budgeting, forecasting, and expertise in Xero or a similar online accounting system.
Familiarity with HR management, including onboarding, employee relations, and HR coordination skills.
Familiarity with legal processes involved with applying for, visas and work permits, and managing contracts with third-party individuals, such as lease agreements.
Proficient in Google Sheets/Excel, Xero or equivalent programs for operational tasks.
Strong analytical and decision-making skills in dynamic environments. Experience in creating management reports, including data visualization.
Thai resident with fluency in Thai and English.




 

How to Apply

Please send your resume and cover letter to ave@bteh.org and support@bteh.org before December 20, 2023. Be sure to include "Operations Manager Application" in the subject line. We look forward to reviewing your application.




Bring The Elephant Home is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, inclusion, and equality. We celebrate the range of diversity, culture, and unique differences within our organization and network. We embrace inclusiveness by encouraging everyone to share their ideas, opinions and knowledge, and we welcome diversity at all levels. Furthermore, inclusion enables out-of-the-box solutions, makes sustainable growth possible, increases resilience, and is essential to creating a just and sustainable world. Bring The Elephant Home is officially registered as a non-profit organization in Thailand.

George Hartel
George Hartel
Chief Commercial Officer at GQ Thailand | The Good Day Lab | Transforming & Scaling Brands for Supara Group | Tech Apparel | Ecommerce | Brand…

GQ Apparel is the innovator of tech apparel in Thailand. As the leading omnichannel brand in the country, we blend innovative technology with contemporary designs to offer wearable solutions that seamlessly fit into everyday life. We're not just setting trends; we're revolutionizing the way people perceive and wear apparel.




Position Overview:

As the Merchandising Manager at GQ Apparel Thailand, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our product assortment is both innovative and commercially viable. You will be at the crossroads of fashion, technology, and business, driving sales while keeping our product offerings fresh and aligned with the brand's vision.




Key Responsibilities:




Product Strategy: Develop and implement merchandising strategies to ensure product assortment meets market demands and financial objectives.




Trend Analysis: Stay updated with fashion and tech trends, ensuring GQ Apparel remains at the forefront of the industry.




Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels, ensuring optimal stock levels that support sales targets without resulting in overstock situations.




Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with the design, marketing, inventory, and sales teams to ensure a seamless flow from product conceptualization to customer purchase.




Reporting: Regularly analyze sales data, providing insights and recommendations to optimize future product assortments.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in Business, Fashion, or a related field.

Minimum of 5 years experience in merchandising, preferably within the apparel sector.

Strong analytical, negotiation, and communication skills.

An eye for detail, coupled with a strategic mindset.

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously.

Familiarity with the Thai market and its consumer preferences.







What We Offer:

At GQ Apparel Thailand, we believe in nurturing talent and fostering growth. As a part of our dynamic team, you will be offered a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and ample opportunities for professional development. Moreover, you'll be shaping the future of tech-infused apparel in one of Asia's most vibrant markets.




Join Us:

If you have the passion, expertise, and vision to elevate GQ Apparel Thailand to even greater heights, we want to hear from you. Be a part of our journey as we redefine the boundaries of fashion and technology in the apparel industry.

Nearly all aspects of our lives involve the use of technology. It is how we work and play and do anything in between. This connectivity or use of data is built into the very fabric of our society. As industry experts and Architects of Continuity, we collaborate with our customers to envision and build future-ready infrastructures. Why Join Us?

Meaningful and Fulfilling Work
Inspiring and Caring Leaders
Global Talent Center
Recharge Your Potential




Job Summary:

This position will be leading the execution of marketing program from global and regional guidance to ensure its effectiveness and success of go-to-market strategy.




Responsibilities:

Assist the local market unit in market analysis and customer intelligence projects, with the assistance of the regional Market Insight Lead
Balance between centralized direction & process (yielding localized leverage), and maintain sensitivity to local nuances and requirements
Sustain adherence to communication schedules with Manila based staff and following the regional Marketing Programs
Energetically communicate with colleagues and management within the local MU to ensure that all executives and functional managers have a sound and updated understanding of all marketing initiatives and how they contribute to functional business objectives

Act as a spearhead to lead the local digital marketing and social media campaigns with the guidance of functional leaders, global and regional marketing and utilize the contacts provided by the local sales team via CRM




Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Mass Communication, Business Administration or equivalent
3 years’ experience in marketing functions from similar industry
Proficient in MS Office Excel
Good communication skills in local and English language
Strong knowledge and experience in marketing communications and media relations

使用键盘、鼠标或轨迹球输入和检索计算机数据库中所含的信息，以更新记录、文件和预订记录，并答复客人的查询。使用计算机、邮件或传真机传输信息或文件。操作计算机以外的标准办公设备。使用文字处理、电子表格、数据库或演示文稿软件，撰写信函、备忘录和其他文件。处理来往邮件，包括盖有日期戳的分发收件。为记录、报告、文档等创建和维护基于计算机和纸张的存档和组织系统。编写、复印、分类和归档办公活动、商业交易和其他活动的记录。使用计算机和/或销售点系统输入和查找工作相关信息。

万豪国际给予所有应聘者公平机会。我们始终坚持打造多元化的员工团队，秉承包容、以人为本的文化。我们绝不歧视任何受保护人群，例如残疾和退伍军人，或适用法律规定的任何其他群体。

บันทึกJob Description

The Reference Data Specialist is responsible for instructions of client deliverables, coding and data input validation focusing on specific industry/category or set of categories (e.g. Beverages, Food, Health and Beauty Products). As a Reference Data Specialist at NielsenIQ, you create and deliver client outputs in a correct and timely manner.


Responsible for instructions of client deliverables, coding and data input validation focusing on specific industry/category or set of categories
Does cross coding and item-related quality checks on a daily basis
May act as a back-up to other coders when needed; conduct physical store check to validate item-related information
Keep track/document special instructions related to category assignment
Plan and execute a complex daily personal workload and support to meet departmental and company schedules
Ensure accuracy throughout the process, from validation before database setup to managing samples, and identify areas for improvement
Answer external questions and act as a liaison with everyone from clients to stakeholders; To be able to identify, investigate and coordinate the resolution of data, process, or product related queries
Willing to be trained to be a category expert


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Business Admin / Statistics or any relevant subjects
Fresh graduate or with 1 year – 2 years’ experience in data and operational areas are welcome
FMCG background or experience as an encoder is a plus
Able to work as part of a team in a multicultural environment
Passionate in data. A high degree of accuracy, good analytical skill and logical thinking
High level of accountability and willingness to take ownership
Eager to learn and willingness to grow
Excel is mandatory; One or more of the following would be added advantage : (SQL, R or Python)
Proactively, willing to voice out and share opinion
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Additional Information

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™.

NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com.
