สมัคร 
บันทึกApplies advanced subject matter knowledge to solve complex business issues and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower level employees.

Responsibilities


Leads a broad range of complex supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis and planning, demand planning, import/export operations, and sales and operations planning (SOP).
Identifies opportunities for process improvement and leads/develops recommendations and provides insight for management.
Independently executes complex demand and supply matching activities, connecting planning to execution, and identifying issues and their impact.
Works cross-functionally to prioritize backlog.
Partners with global business units and supply bases to generate and deliver demand signals.
Leads cross-functional regional and global business unit planning teams to maintain and enhance the current business processes.
Defines and reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement actions to address.
Contributes to priority projects by adding creative insights and developing recommendations.
Communicates requirements and guidelines to the regional and global business unit planning teams.
Mentors junior-level staff and establishes guidelines for the mentorship programs.


Education And Experience Required


First level university degree or equivalent experience; advanced university degree preferred.
Typically 6-10 years of experience in a supply chain function.
Experience in more than one supply chain function.
Broker's license and/or 6-10 years of experience in a customs/global trade function.


Knowledge And Skills


Excellent understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).
Identifies cutting edge analytical tools, models and methods for making key business decisions.
Excellent communication and influencing skills; mastery in English and local language.
Excellent internal and external relationship management skills.
Extensive knowledge and understanding of how to analyze business problems using Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Very Strong project management skills, with capability to manage cross functional teams in multiple geographies.
Strong business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Very strong understanding of HP's overall supply chain strategy.
Excellent understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP), ATP and master scheduling.
Excellent understanding of national and international trade requirements to align customs/trade function with business objectives.
Thorough knowledge of inventory modeling and analysis.
Strong leadership skills including team-building and conflict resolution and management.


About HP

You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

บันทึกProfile: Local Companies, Institutions, Organisations, etc., or Private Consultants

Location: Thailand




NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields. With more than 1.100 international projects and studies already completed, and 16 project offices around the world, we have established ourselves as a leading consulting company. With the expansion of international activities and clients, NTU’s project pipeline and opportunities have grown significantly, therefore, we are looking for a motivated and result oriented individual and/or company, institution or organisation, who is interested in experiencing being part of our international success.







NTU is leading a consortium for the EU SIEA 2023 LOT 4 – Sustainable Transport, Infrastructures, Green Cities, Connectivity and Sustainable Mobility and we are looking to expand our network with skilled local partners from the target countries.







The relevant sectors for this project are the following:




Sustainable Transport and Infrastructure
Urban Development and Cities
Rural Infrastructure







We invite interested Private Consultants and Local Companies, Institutions, Organisations, etc. to confirm their interest by submitting a short application for our Local Partner Network in your region.

Name of local partner
Country of registration
Country(ies) where the entity is operating
Short description of the organisation you represent

Please also make sure that you include one or more telephone numbers and an email which we may use to get in contact with you.

NTU will register your interest and should there be a specific opportunity in the country of your operation we will contact you with specific details.

We encourage all applicants to follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ntu-international/

Please note that this will be an ongoing contract and Local Partners will be contacted accordingly to the assignment in which their expertise lies within.




Only selected candidates will be contacted.

- Promptly escalate critical/ high-risk cases to the appropriate authority.

- Eager to learn, initiative taker and problem-solver.

- Good written and verbal communication skills in English & Thai.

Guillaume Martin
Guillaume Martin
International leader interested in General Management roles involving P&L

Would you like to make an impact around you? Do you have the spark that ignites energy in others? The values of Family, Nature and Sports resonate with you? Then read on, this job is for you!




To enrich the living experience of our community, the Community Manager serves as the linchpin between residents, staffs, and external stakeholders, ensuring excellent service and a harmonious community atmosphere.

The Community Manager is also the Project Owner of our Miyawaki Pocket Forest; with a complete communication plan to be defined and implemented (e.g. TV, press release, etc.)

Key Responsibilities

On-Site Management:

·     Event and Activity Planning: Conduct regular surveys to gauge resident interests. Create and coordinate a Master Schedule of activities (e.g. tennis tournaments, billiard, kids’ activities -with some open to outside organizations- and events that align with key milestones, such as Songkran and Christmas).

Implement defined software for online booking to facilitate tennis & squash court reservations.

·     Open Communication Channels: Facilitate open lines of communication between staff and residents. Collect feedback and suggestions. Regularly update residents on upcoming projects, events, and community news.

·     Community Involvement: Recruit and coordinate volunteers for special projects and initiatives, such as the Miyawaki Pocket Forest.

·     Document & Content Management: Create, curate and communicate high-quality documents and content (e.g. newsletters, in alignment with the Brand Manual, to enhance community engagement and information dissemination).

Digital and External Outreach:

·     Brand Advocacy: Promote the community's brand image through strategic use of social media platforms like LinkedIn and Facebook.

Provide regular updates on key online metrics.

·     Stakeholder Engagement: Establish partnerships with local influencers, Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs), and real estate agents to elevate the asset value of the property.




Qualifications

·     Bachelor's degree or equivalent

·     3+ years' in marketing, advertising or related role

·     Strong written and verbal communication skills

·     Fluent in both Thai and English languages




Compensation and benefits: 60 to 90k per month depending on experience




About Us: President Park is an upscale condominium located on Sukhumvit soi 24 in Bangkok. Completed in 1994, it offers 400 units and 60,000+sqm of common area. Additionally, it currently hosts more than 800 people, including 200+ kids of all ages.

The community has its own, stand-alone, Juristic Office with a General Manager and approximately 70 staffs (incl. 30 contractors).

Would you like to find out more, please visit our website!

สมัคร
บันทึกส่งข้อความโดยตรงถึงผู้ประกาศรับสมัครงานจาก Bring the Elephant Home Foundation

Antoinette Van de Water, PhD
Antoinette Van de Water, PhD
Elephant conservation, research and policy development

Operations Manager

Bring The Elephant Home

For a world where elephants and people can thrive




                                                                                                                          

Organization:  Foundation Bring The Elephant Home

Start date: January 15, 2024  

Position: Part-time, 3 days a week

Contract: 1 year (3 months probation, opportunity to extend) 

Based in: Remote - one visit at the end of each month to Ruam Thai 

Kui Buri, Prachuap Khiri Khan. 




 

Introduction Bring The Elephant Home

 

Bring The Elephant Home is dedicated to ensuring the well-being and survival of Asian elephants, fostering socio-ecological resilience, and striving for a world where both elephants and people can thrive. Our community-based conservation approach, developed over a decade, emphasizes shared decision-making, sustainability, equality, and partnerships. Through our projects, we promote human-elephant coexistence by supporting farmers in elephant-friendly livelihoods and land use, contributing to meaningful coexistence between elephants and people. 




Your Role




As the Operations Manager, you will play a crucial role in the development of our organization. 

Your responsibilities include:




Financial Management:




Monitor the foundation's financial health, ensuring adherence to financial policies and procedures.
Prepare and analyze monthly reports on budgets and funds utilization, providing insights into financial performance.
Assist in creating annual financial reports and forecasting activities, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory requirements.
Co-manage Bring The Elephant Home’s online accounting platforms, Xero and Xero Expenses, to ensure accurate financial records.
Collaborate with the accountants and BTEH’s field staff to input monthly financial data into Xero and work with them to auto-generate reports for both internal use and funders.
Coordinate fund requests to Bring The Elephant Home Netherlands and submit necessary financial reports.




HR Management:




Oversee the administrative onboarding process for new staff by registering their profiles on our payroll and other organizational platforms.
Manage monthly payroll registration information.
Prepare, save, and print staff pay slips for submission to the accounting office monthly.
Coordinate WHT (PND.53) e-filing and send certificates to the payroll office.
Handle administrative aspects of employee relations, including raises, corrective actions, employment agreements, vacation leave, reimbursement requests, employee manuals, benefits administration, and any other legal matters related to their employment with Bring The Elephant Home.




Legal Management:




Manage a small group of international staff members’ visas and work permits.
Manage Ruam Thai office registration, lease agreements, and other legal documentation.




 

Your qualifications

 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, accounting, human resources, finance or related field.
Proven experience in general management, financial oversight, budgeting, forecasting, and expertise in Xero or a similar online accounting system.
Familiarity with HR management, including onboarding, employee relations, and HR coordination skills.
Familiarity with legal processes involved with applying for, visas and work permits, and managing contracts with third-party individuals, such as lease agreements.
Proficient in Google Sheets/Excel, Xero or equivalent programs for operational tasks.
Strong analytical and decision-making skills in dynamic environments. Experience in creating management reports, including data visualization.
Thai resident with fluency in Thai and English.




 

How to Apply

Please send your resume and cover letter to ave@bteh.org and support@bteh.org before December 20, 2023. Be sure to include "Operations Manager Application" in the subject line. We look forward to reviewing your application.




Bring The Elephant Home is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, inclusion, and equality. We celebrate the range of diversity, culture, and unique differences within our organization and network. We embrace inclusiveness by encouraging everyone to share their ideas, opinions and knowledge, and we welcome diversity at all levels. Furthermore, inclusion enables out-of-the-box solutions, makes sustainable growth possible, increases resilience, and is essential to creating a just and sustainable world. Bring The Elephant Home is officially registered as a non-profit organization in Thailand.

George Hartel
George Hartel
Chief Commercial Officer at GQ Thailand | The Good Day Lab | Transforming & Scaling Brands for Supara Group | Tech Apparel | Ecommerce | Brand…

GQ Apparel is the innovator of tech apparel in Thailand. As the leading omnichannel brand in the country, we blend innovative technology with contemporary designs to offer wearable solutions that seamlessly fit into everyday life. We're not just setting trends; we're revolutionizing the way people perceive and wear apparel.




Position Overview:

As the Merchandising Manager at GQ Apparel Thailand, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring our product assortment is both innovative and commercially viable. You will be at the crossroads of fashion, technology, and business, driving sales while keeping our product offerings fresh and aligned with the brand's vision.




Key Responsibilities:




Product Strategy: Develop and implement merchandising strategies to ensure product assortment meets market demands and financial objectives.




Trend Analysis: Stay updated with fashion and tech trends, ensuring GQ Apparel remains at the forefront of the industry.




Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels, ensuring optimal stock levels that support sales targets without resulting in overstock situations.




Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with the design, marketing, inventory, and sales teams to ensure a seamless flow from product conceptualization to customer purchase.




Reporting: Regularly analyze sales data, providing insights and recommendations to optimize future product assortments.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in Business, Fashion, or a related field.

Minimum of 5 years experience in merchandising, preferably within the apparel sector.

Strong analytical, negotiation, and communication skills.

An eye for detail, coupled with a strategic mindset.

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously.

Familiarity with the Thai market and its consumer preferences.







What We Offer:

At GQ Apparel Thailand, we believe in nurturing talent and fostering growth. As a part of our dynamic team, you will be offered a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and ample opportunities for professional development. Moreover, you'll be shaping the future of tech-infused apparel in one of Asia's most vibrant markets.




Join Us:

If you have the passion, expertise, and vision to elevate GQ Apparel Thailand to even greater heights, we want to hear from you. Be a part of our journey as we redefine the boundaries of fashion and technology in the apparel industry.

Manages relationships with Qatar Airways’ corporate and trade customers. Engages in joint sales and marketing activity to grow the level and quality of QR revenue sold through these partners and driving efficiencies in the distribution processes.
Develops and maintains long term strategic relationships with Qatar Airways’ Trade partners and corporate clients.

Reviews QR sales data with account portfolio to drive revenue and seek out tactical revenue opportunities.

Develops tactical Sales and Marketing activity in support of sales opportunities in both Trade Partners and Corporate market place.

Responsible for continuously improving the quality and timeliness of account performance and decision-support efforts for Sales.

Be part of an extraordinary story

Your skills. Your imagination. Your ambition. Here, there are no boundaries to your potential and the impact you can make. You’ll find infinite opportunities to grow and work on the biggest, most rewarding challenges that will build your skills and experience. You have the chance to be a part of our future, and build the life you want while being part of an international community. Our best is here and still to come. To us, impossible is only a challenge. Join us as we dare to achieve what’s never been done before. Together, everything is possible

Qualifications

Minimum 4 years of job-related experience required
Knowledge of GDS System, ticketing and selling experience


You must have the legal rights to live and work in Thailand to be considered for this role

About Qatar Airways Group

Our story started with four aircraft. Today, we deliver excellence across 12 different businesses coming together as one. We’ve grown fast, broken records and set trends that others follow. We don’t slow down by the fear of failure. Instead, we dare to achieve what’s never been done before.

So whether you’re creating a unique experience for our customers or innovating behind the scenes, every person contributes to our proud story. A story of spectacular growth and determination. Now is the time to bring your best ideas and passion to a place where your ambition will know no boundaries, and be part of a truly global community.

Consumer Research & Data Analyst, Thailand
Mintel  เขตปริมณฑลกรุงเทพมหานคร
36 นาทีก่อน   มาเป็นหนึ่งในผู้สมัคร 25 คนแรก
  
ดูบุคคลที่ Mintel ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร 
บันทึกFrom fast answers to deep insights, Mintel has provided research and intelligence solutions to consumer-focused businesses for more than 50 years. With a combination of world-class syndicated tools and custom insight solutions, we are the eyes and ears in the markets that matter and the insights behind our clients’ next big idea.




Do you enjoy working with consumer research and data? The world’s leading market intelligence agency, Mintel, is seeking a highly organised consumer researcher to join its Consumer Research and Data Analytics team.




Based in Bangkok, this role will support our syndicated consumer research projects in Thailand and will be working with the reporting team to provide a first-class level of quantitative consumer analysis. This role will manage the day-to-day research projects from questionnaire design through fieldwork and data analysis, and support the South APAC region in delivering high level of quantitative consumer research.







What You Will Be Doing:

Designing consumer surveys: Working with internal reporting team to design online quantitative questionnaires in English that meet research objectives and analysis requirements.
Research project management: Liaising with external providers and internal resources to manage research projects independently to ensure all research is conducted within budget and to deadline. This also includes checking outputs and troubleshooting queries.
Analysing data: Using a wide range of data analysis tools including SPSS, R and others to tabulate and analyze quantitative consumer research data effectively. This also includes running advanced statistical analysis which includes, but is not limited to, correspondence analysis, CHAID (decision tree analysis), cluster analysis (segmentation) and forecasting.
Training & development: Helping conduct consumer research training with internal report teams (including questionnaire design, data analysis, and using internal reporting tools) and acting as a consultant to within the organization by providing expertise in internal tools, data analysis interpreting statistical analysis.
Maintaining internal databases: Gathering market data through desk research and managing internal database of macro-economic environment.







Who We Are Looking For:

2+ year’s work experience within a consumer research agency/client-side environment
Bachelor’s degree or a comparable degree with a minimum of 2:1 in a relevant subject
Experience managing consumer research projects in Thailand is essential
Strong knowledge of designing and analysing quantitative research (both online and offline) from questionnaire design to data output
Proven experience with analysing data in R or SPSS (or similar statistical software) in commercial setting
Highly organised with experience of managing multiple research projects to deadlines
Excellent analytical and interpretative skills with the ability to communicate data, statistics and other research-related concepts to non-researchers
Experience of searching or using secondary data, such as industry or government data
High attention to detail with a focus on ensuring quality data
A strong team player willing to help out others both within and outside the team
A high degree of numeracy




What We Offer:

Culture that supports true collaboration whilst embracing remote working.
Flexible start and end times.
Blended (office/home) approach to work.
Approach to personal development where we encourage individuals to grow and share what they’ve learned.
Social events, both within the department and across the company.
Generous annual leave and wider circle employee benefits.
Additional one day off to celebrate your birthday.
Membership in Employee Resource Groups (Mintel Diversity, Mintel Wellness and Mintel Gives).
Giving back is part of our culture with this in mind, Mintel gives employee 2 days leave per year to join local volunteering activity organised by our Mintel Gives (where applicable).
Mental health and wellbeing support via Modern Health App and Employee Assistance Programme.
Beautifully designed offices to foster collaboration and fun.




Mintel is an equal opportunity employer that committed to the strength of an inclusive workplace.

Company Overview:

PSG® is a global leader in the manufacture of pumps, sensors, systems and related flow-control solutions for the safe, efficient and reliable transfer of critical and valuable materials. PSG features world-class pump brands – Wilden®, Blackmer®, Neptune™, Almatec®, Mouvex®, Griswold™, Ebsray® and Quattroflow™ – committed to servicing key vertical markets that include Hygienic, Chemical and Energy. We are dedicated to innovative technologies that will positively impact the world. We are a part of the global community with localized presence in over 100 countries, and multiple facilities in the U.S., France, Germany, India and China that are ISO certified. At PSG, we are passionately committed to the development of innovative “sustainable” technologies. We are relentless in our pursuit of excellence, and confident in the market knowledge and expertise we bring to our customers.

We thrive on winning and being number one; and are always looking to add the best and brightest to our talented team of professionals. PSG offers a unique combination of the both small company atmosphere: with an ownership mindset that allows you to make close-to-the-customer decisions; an innovative approach in seeing beyond what is possible today and entrepreneurial spirit in the pursuit of new opportunities; combined with benefits of a large company’s scale, tools, expertise and financial strength with Dover. Join PSG, a growing global company where your curiosity, hard work and ambition is rewarded with exceptional career opportunities in a friendly & fast paced environment. Welcome aboard!

PSG is part of the Fluids segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer with annual revenues in excess of $7 billion.




Position Summary:

The Regional Sales Manager, is accountable for the profitable growth of the Hydro’s business his territory.

He/she has responsibility for implementing Hydro’s “Go to Market” strategy as established by or in conjunction

with the Regional Sales Senior Director.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:




· Identify and develop opportunities within the Southeast Asia region, including within Malaysia, Singapore.

· Promotion of Hydro Systems complete range to grow the top line sales and protect and grow margins.

· Strengthen our cooperation with strategic accounts in APAC.

· Lead, develop and deliver business development opportunities that will enable rapid revenue growth, including but not limited to: Conceiving, developing and delivering sales strategies and commercial activities to support business growth.

· Build commercial and value creation strategies with the APAC leadership team.

· Analyze and translate market intelligence into execution plans to drive revenue growth.

· Coordinate strategy account business at APAC level, and work with global strategy account business leader.

· Collaborate with APAC Marketing to support commercial initiatives through the: Creation and implementation of promotional strategies to support the sales effort.

· Identification of market intelligence needs, undertake and coordinate market studies and analysis as requested.

· Identification of product needs and competitive analysis.

· Contribute to Hydro’s new product development efforts through a comprehensive understanding of end user environments. Generate the business case and assist in the preparation of PDRs designed to drive business growth in region.

· Identify and recommend opportunities for partnerships and acquisitions of companies that can deliver growth for Hydro in existing and new adjacent market segments.

· Communicate results and key performance drivers to management and peer organizations and administer the sales process.

· Assist Regional Sales Senior Director to identify growth opportunity and develop APAC growth strategy.

· Other responsibilities as business needs require.




Qualifications/Requirements:

· At least 10 years proven sales selling of value added (premium) products, preferably commercial/ industrial/technical product;

· B.S. or equivalent degree required; MBA preferred.

· Experience in the chemical cleaning industry, janitorial/sanitation, laundry, food service, building services, preferred.

· Strong business development experience – identifying targets, creating prospects and turning them into customers and maintaining long term relationships.

· Superior management, planning and organizational skills.

· Strong ability and desire to build and manage collaborative relationships.

· Ability to build trust and create followership among team members.

· Expert negotiation skills.

· Strong communication and presentation skills.

· Strong capacity to coordinate and align different teams to common results, including conflict management.

· Proven analytical/problem-solving skills, ability to prioritize, allocate and manage resources.

· Comfortable (either through experience or desire) with “Hydro” type culture, i.e., lean, flat organizational structure, requiring hands on approach.

· Hardworking, honest, ethical, competitive and committed.

· Strong written and spoken English skills, required. Mandarin preferred.

· Willing to travel 30-40%.

· Ability to create value for customers addressing both known and unknown needs.

ดูบุคคลที่ PepsiCo ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร 
บันทึกOverview

Asia Beverages and GMD BU is a fast-growing business in Asia comprising 13 markets across beverages and snacks plus a start-up COSO business in Indonesia. FP&A Lead is responsible for driving financial planning agenda for the BU. Key FP&A processes include forecasts, AOP,long-term strategic plans, performance management and transformation initiatives for the financial planning function. In addition, the FP&A Lead will provide finance thought leadership in developing performance metrics for the BU.

Responsibilities


Lead AOP and monthly forecasting processes, working closely with Cluster and Sector planning team, to secure deliverables per planning calendars, ensuring timeliness,quality, and accuracy.
Partner with CFO/BUGM on AOP/Forecast target setting process, balancing opportunities, and challenges across BU portfolio.
Lead and support development of Financial and commercial presentations to BU/Sector/Corporate, including performance letters, POR, AOP, Townhalls and any other requirements.
Lead HQ Opex management, including AOP/Forecast budgets, market allocations,monthly tracking and reporting to functions to ensure delivery on targets.
Partner with CFO/Cluster finance leads to drive portfolio performance in line withAOP/Forecasts, balancing investments behind growth priorities, risks, and opportunities.
Drive productivity initiatives across BU and clusters, including Opex and marketing spends.
Lead performance management reporting to BU/Sector/Corporate, providing financial analysis on overall business results and insights around key P&L drivers.
Partner with CFO/BUGM on PEP+ agenda and multi-market business development projects
Drive Planning Transformation in coordination with Sector/Global project and support teams to implement global digital tools and initiatives at the BU.
Drive standardization and simplification of planning and reporting processes across markets.
Drive robust governance between Planning & GBS teams by defining ways of working and supporting transition.
Build engagement, coaching and development across BU/GBS planning teams


Qualifications


Master’s Degree: Specialization in Finance and Accounting
At least 10 years of proven finance experience in an FMCG and relevant work experience in FP&A/ Commercial Planning
Good understanding of Beverage industry and franchise business fundamentals
Strong analytical and presentation skills: highly capable in Microsoft Excel and PPT
Strong communication skills: ability to think strategically, articulate and influencestakeholders.
Strong inter-personal skills: ability to work with multi-functional, multi-country and multi-cultural teams.
Strong resilience and result orientation: ability to withstand pressure and manage planned and ad-hoc timelines

Responsibilities

Good understanding of R&D and product development disciplines, as well as regulatory requirements is desirable
Be able to work well under pressure
Fluent in English and computer skills e.g. Microsoft office and digital tools

Assessment Specialist, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
Crossover  กรุงเทพมหานคร

ดูบุคคลที่ Crossover ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร
บันทึกCrossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?

Are you wired to dissect and design with a level of precision that only the keenest eye can achieve? Can you excel in an environment where elevated standards are the baseline, turning intricate challenges into elegant solutions is your second nature?

We're scouting for an AI mastermind with a flair for distilling complexity into clarity to sculpt revolutionary educational experiences. Think you have checked all the right boxes so far? Then this is your opportunity to shine.

At Trilogy, we're not just tinkering with the idea of AI in education; we're orchestrating a full-blown transformation. Scrap the old playbook of manual test creation. Textbooks? Obsolete. In this role, you will wield the power of generative AI to design prompts that delve deep into the subject matter, commanding it to produce test content that's personalized, engaging, and rigorous.

Your experience with various prompting techniques will help you synthesize complex frameworks into AI prompts, yielding razor-sharp test questions that align tightly with educational standards. You will then quality control your outputs by crafting AI-first rubrics, ensuring each question and answer hits the mark and stimulates curiosity, enriching the learning journey.

It's all about a relentless pursuit of excellence, a continuous cycle of refinement, and a dedication to content that not only meets but exceeds the bar.

If you're seeking a role where you can blend creativity with technology and where your contributions have a lasting impact, Trilogy is where you belong. Take the leap and apply now!

What You Will Be Doing


Designing AI prompts that can generate test questions meticulously aligned with the defined educational standards
Leveraging AI to create rubrics that evaluate the depth and alignment of the test content created
Enhancing test content through a streamlined, iterative process for consistently superior and challenging assessments


What You Won’t Be Doing


Creating test content manually – you will be using generative AI tools for every task
Developing code to automate systems - you will focus on test design using AI, while our engineers handle the tech specifics


Assessment Specialist Key Responsibilities

Using generative AI and advanced prompting techniques to craft test content that's personalized, rigorous, and aligned with educational standards

Basic Requirements


A university degree (BA, BS, MS, or PhD) in any field
Experience creating content for standardized education tests (such as SAT, ACT, entrance exams, etc.)
Experience with generative AI, particularly in crafting complex prompts using advanced techniques (e.g. few-shot, zero-shot, chain of thought, self-consistency)
A user-centric approach and the ability to critically evaluate content in terms of appropriateness, accuracy, and relevance


About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with Crossover

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

What to expect next:


You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


Important! If you do not receive an email from us:


First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


Crossover Job Code: LJ-5159-TH-Bangkok-AssessmentSpec

บันทึกLocal Partner Network – LOT 1 – Climate Change, Sustainable Energy, Nuclear Safety




Profile: Local Companies, Institutions, Organisations, etc., or Private Consultants

Location: Thailand




NTU International is a leading international consulting firm providing programme management and advisory services for development projects worldwide. For almost three decades, NTU has been delivering sustainable development projects and advisory services within engineering, policy, economics, and social fields. With more than 1.100 international projects and studies already completed, and 16 project offices around the world, we have established ourselves as a leading consulting company. With the expansion of international activities and clients, NTU’s project pipeline and opportunities have grown significantly, therefore, we are looking for a motivated and result oriented individual and/or company, institution or organisation, who is interested in experiencing being part of our international success.




NTU is leading a consortium for the EU SEA 2023 Framework LOT 1 – Climate Change, Sustainable Energy, Nuclear Safety and we are looking to expand our network with skilled local partners from the target countries.




The relevant sectors for this project are the following:




Climate Change
Sustainable Energy
Nuclear Safety
Disaster Risk Reduction




We invite interested Private Consultants and Local Companies, Institutions, Organisations, etc. to confirm their interest by submitting a short application for our Local Partner Network in your region.

If you are interested in this position, please apply and upload your profile with information on:

Name of local partner
Country of registration
Country(ies) where the entity is operating
Short description of the organisation you represent

Please also make sure that you include one or more telephone numbers and an email which we may use to get in contact with you.




NTU will register your interest and should there be a specific opportunity in the country of your operation we will contact you with specific details.




We encourage all applicants to follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ntu-international/




Please note that this will be an ongoing contract and Local Partners will be contacted accordingly to the assignment in which their expertise lies within.







Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Sales Manager (Remote) - Thailand

Company: eTeam

Location: Remote (Thailand)

Job Type: Full-Time







About eTeam:




eTeam is a global provider of workforce solutions, specializing in recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting. With a focus on delivering top-notch services to our clients, we are expanding our team in Thailand and seeking a dynamic Sales Manager to drive business growth and establish strong client relationships.




Responsibilities:




Client Acquisition:




Proactively identify and engage potential clients in the recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting sectors.
Develop and execute effective sales strategies to acquire new business.




Relationship Building:




Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and prospective clients in the IT industry.
Understand client needs and tailor recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting solutions to meet their requirements.




Market Research:




Stay informed about IT industry trends, competition, and market developments.
Utilize market insights to position eTeam as a leader in recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting.




Sales Presentations:




Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations to showcase eTeam's services in recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting.
Effectively communicate the value proposition and unique selling points across all service offerings.




Target Achievement:




Set and achieve sales targets in alignment with company objectives for recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting.
Regularly report on sales performance and provide insights for improvement.




Collaboration:




Work closely with the recruitment and IT teams to ensure seamless delivery of services.
Collaborate with internal teams to address client needs and challenges in both recruitment and IT solutions.




Qualifications:




Proven Sales Experience:




Demonstrated success in sales, preferably in the recruitment, IT Services, or IT Consulting industry.
Track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.




Excellent Communication Skills:




Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Thai.
Ability to articulate complex IT ideas and solutions clearly.




Client-Focused




Customer-centric mindset with a commitment to delivering exceptional service in recruitment, IT Services, and IT Consulting.
Ability to build and nurture client relationships.




Self-Motivated:




Proactive and self-driven with the ability to work independently.
Results-oriented with a strong sense of accountability.




Adaptability:




Comfortable working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Willingness to adapt to evolving IT industry trends and client needs.

Strong communicator to manage internal and external relationships.

Essential Requirements

Displayed behaviours aligned to G4S’s values
St.rong, resilient nature to deliver constructive support daily
Ability to deal with challenging situations
Energetic and enthusiastic approach to challenges within the business
A commitment to the G4S Vision, Values and Policies, including Equal Employment Opportunity, Human Rights and Occupational Health and Safety principles and practices




Health and Safety

Follow the G4S Golden Rules – consider your safety and the safety of others.

As an employee of G4S, you are responsible for your safety.

Partipost is building a platform that connects brands with genuine people to launch organic marketing campaigns. We believe in giving the crowd a voice, and that social media advocates have the power to call their followers into action. We are committed to building solutions with our users' needs as a priority.




We are looking for you!

The Business Development Executive will be tasked to turbo-charge our energetic sales team to build relationships with agencies as well as new and existing clients directly. Able to consistently hit or surpass challenging, yet achievable targets and structuring packages based on needs of the client.




The Business Development Executive will report to our Chief of Staff in Singapore. This position is primarily based in Bangkok Thailand, and is a great opportunity for someone who is interested in the ever changing social media marketing with an ever versatile platform to meet marketing needs.




Responsibilities:

Able to research, prospect, and build a sales pipeline of qualified leads in Thailand (Media, Creative, Public Relations, Influencer Marketing and Marketing Agencies, as well as direct brands)

Based in Bangkok
Fluent in Thai and English (spoken and written)
Passionate about social media, digital advertising and influencer marketing
Existing relationships with brands and advertising/marketing agencies
Strong digital sales with preferably more than 2 years experience in digital media space - content and influencer marketing experience is a bonus
A results driven person who is able to work in a fast paced environment and has excellent interpersonal skills




Benefits:

Competitive salary
Competitive commission structure
Hybrid working structure
Great open office culture and team culture
Hybrid work environment
Great career development opportunities in a growing company

สมัคร 
บันทึกAn exciting Area Manager (Luxury Retail) (x 1 vacancy) job has just become available at one of the luxury brand based in Bangkok. Reporting directly to the Retail Director this is a role for a Area Manager or Operation Manager who is a leader in their field.

About Area Manager (Luxury Retail)

We are seeking a hands-on and experienced Area Manager to oversee our luxury retail operations in Thailand. The Area Manager will be responsible for developing and executing the business strategy, driving sales growth, and ensuring smooth operations across multiple locations. This role requires a strong background in luxury retail management, a deep understanding of the Thai market, and the ability to effectively lead and motivate teams. This role offers a competitive base salary with attractive bonus.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement a comprehensive business strategy for the luxury retail market in Thailand, aligned with the company's overall goals and objectives
Analyse sales performance data and market trends to identify areas for improvement and develop action plans to increase sales and market share
Provide guidance and support to store managers and sales teams to ensure exceptional customer service and maximise sales opportunities
Oversee the day-to-day operations of multiple luxury retail stores, ensuring compliance with company policies, procedures, and brand standards
Monitor inventory levels, product assortments, and replenishment strategies to optimise stock availability and minimise stockouts
Collaborate with the operations team to streamline processes, improve operational efficiency, and enhance the overall customer experience
Provide strong leadership and guidance to store managers and sales teams, fostering a culture of excellence, teamwork, and high-performance
Train, coach, and mentor store managers to effectively manage their teams, drive sales, and deliver exceptional customer service
Conduct regular performance evaluations, set objectives, and provide feedback to ensure continuous development and growth of the team
Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including luxury brand partners, landlords, and suppliers
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, visual merchandising, and HR, to ensure effective communication and execution of brand strategies


To succeed in this role, you must have good communication skills in English.

Key Requirements


Proven experience as an Area Manager or Operation manager in luxury retail
In-depth knowledge and understanding of the luxury retail industry, market trends, and customer preferences in Thailand
Hands-on experience in driving sales growth and achieving targets in a luxury retail environment
Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire teams to deliver exceptional results
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships with stakeholders at all levels
Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, adapting to changing priorities
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and retail management software


This leading company needs no introduction and is recognised as the leader in their field of expertise. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant.

If you are a hands-on and experienced luxury retail professional with a deep understanding of the Thai market, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to shape and drive our business strategy, sales, and operations in Thailand.

Apply Today!

Due to the high volume of applications, our team will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Paleerat Noppakhun
Paleerat Noppakhun
Talent Acquisition Manager at Minor International

Assistant Compliance Manager will assist the direct line manager and the Head of Risk, Control, and Compliance (RCC) in managing and supervising the compliance programs, and to facilitate compliance to the standards, rules, regulations, policies, laws, codes of conduct, and other guidelines. In addition, provide assistance to the direct line manager in ensuring the company's adherence to data protection standards and regulations.




Responsibilities




Assist in monitoring and ensuring the company’s compliance with the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) and other relevant data protection regulations.
Assist with the collaboration between RCC Dept and the DPCs of Minor Food, Hotel, and Lifestyle BUs to ensure consistent application of data protection standards across all units.
Assist in maintaining updated central record of Minor processing activities.
Assist in the development of systems or process to monitor the progress of critical data protection activities.
Provide input to the risks assessment process for identifying relevant compliance risks.
Assist in the development of an annual plan to monitor Corporate Compliance activities.
Review incoming requests related to Business Partner Code of Conduct and Team Member Code of Conduct and escalate the requests for approval.
Assist in the development of systems or process to monitor the progress of Corporate Compliance activities.
Assist with the development of creating effective action plans in response to audit discoveries and compliance violations.
Provide input to the development relevant policies, procedures, and guidelines tailored for MINT, ensuring they align with the company's objectives and regulatory requirements.
Coordinate incoming requests and escalate any amendments to relevant policies as required by individual BUs.
Provide input and assists with the roll out of revenant policies, procedures, and guidelines.
Organize and coordinate meetings with each focal point of each business groups.
Act as a point of contact for inquiries in relation to Corporate Compliance and Data Protection and escalate inquiries to the appropriate level.
Provide input to training contents for Corporate Compliance and Data Protection
Ensure that the monthly/bi-monthly newsletter is prepared and circulated.
Collaborate with Internal Communication team for mass communication of messages relevant to Corporate Compliance and Data Protection.
Collaborate with the focal point of business groups to promote awareness across the company.

Qualification

Bachelor’s degree in Law, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in compliance, data protection, or a related field.
Experience in compliance, data protection or a related role.
Knowledge of the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) and other relevant data protection regulations.
Experience in hospitality business, casual dining restaurant business and/or retail business would be an advantage.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work collaboratively and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders across various Business units.

About Kerry

Kerry is the world's leading taste and nutrition company for the food, beverage and pharmaceutical industries. Every day we partner with customers to create healthier, tastier and more sustainable products that are consumed by billions of people across the world. Our vision is to be our customers' most valued partner, creating a world of sustainable nutrition. A career with Kerry offers you an opportunity to shape the future of food while providing you opportunities to explore and grow in a truly global environment.

About The Role

In this position of Compliance Controller - Thailand you will be a ‘hands-on’ Senior Financial Business Professional with self-starting capabilities.

They will be a qualified accountant with at least 5-7 years’ experience. Hold CPA/CIMA/ACCA or local equivalent professional certificate. Fluency in English and local language are essential for this role.

Key responsibilities


Management of the annual financial audit process
Management of the direct and indirect tax requirements for the Thailand operating company including regular reconciliation for financial control purposes
Ensure that all statutory filing requirements are met, not limiting to direct & indirect taxes, transfer price, legal, payroll, corporate governance and regulations include dealing with Custom & Tax authorities.
Ensures maintenance of accurate and complete financial records, in compliance with both legal requirements, local accounting and IFRS standards.
Leads the effort of establishing, monitoring, and enforcing an effective internal controls environment. Liaises with internal and external auditors
Identify best practices and continuous improvement opportunities and facilitates embedment of the practices into the organization.
Develops and improves accounting and control policies, procedures, work processes and reporting systems to support growth and efficiency, while reducing complexity and increasing speed.
Plays a key role in assisting Management in key financial decisions by providing business and financial recommendations on Company specific development and projects.
Lead and project manage all financial relevant areas on Company specific growth initiatives and strategies
Meets Corporate financial reporting requirements in a timely and accurate manner.
Monitors legal, tax and regulatory changes and trends to identify and implement necessary actions to secure continued compliance, while pro-actively identifying emerging opportunities and threats, making recommendations to management.
Support treasury initiatives and reporting requirement
Coordinate local operation and functioning of SSC (AP,AR and GL) through review to ensure achievement and compliance of policies, standards and regulations.
Support audit readiness and assist in planning and preparation for future compliance audits.


Qualifications And Skills


Strong Project Management skills/experience
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite
SAP knowledge
P&L Management
Astute business and commercial acumen
Risk management
Improvement and standardization of processes
Knowledge of Indonesian local statutory requirement – audit, direct and indirect tax requirements
Relationship builder (internally and with customers) with excellent communications skills
Likes autonomy and is pro-active
Results driven
Team player (recognizes successes)
Decisive (takes tough decisions on priorities)
Challenges status quo
Ability to communicate financial information to non-financial mangers
Solution orientated management style
Well-developed interpersonal skills and able to establish trust and credibility


Beware of scams online or from individuals claiming to represent us. A Kerry employee will not solicit candidates through a non-Kerry email address or phone number. In addition, Kerry does not currently utilise video chat rooms (e.g., Google Hangouts) to conduct interviews. Refuse any request that asks you to provide payment to participate in the hiring process (e.g., purchasing a “starter kit,” investing in training, or something similar). Kerry will not ask you to pay any money at any point in the hiring process with the exception of reimbursable travel expenses. In addition, any payments made by Kerry will be from official firm accounts bearing the Kerry name.

Senior Trade Compliance Specialist
Oracle  กรุงเทพมหานคร, ประเทศไทย
5 ชั่วโมงก่อน   มาเป็นหนึ่งในผู้สมัคร 25 คนแรก
  
ดูบุคคลที่ Oracle ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร
บันทึกส่งข้อความโดยตรงถึงผู้ประกาศรับสมัครงานจาก Oracle

Guendeline Phoon
Guendeline Phoon
Regional Talent Advisor at Oracle

Overview

Oracle is the #1 global provider of business software! With an outstanding presence in over 175 countries, we connect the biggest enterprises of today with the tools to challenge in the digital economy of tomorrow. Join us and play an instrumental role in redefining the world of business! Thrive in this crucial role.




Description

What You’ll Do

Are you a creative person who loves a challenge? Solve the complex puzzles you’ve been dreaming of as our Senior Trade Compliance Specialist.




Oracle Global Trade Compliance team is seeking experienced Senior Trade Compliance Specialist serving as focal point for Customs compliance oversight of Oracle declarations for Thailand, Australia, Malaysia, Singapore, Pakistan and all APAC indirect countries. In this role, you will apply your skills in interpreting customs regulations to assess applicability and impact to Oracle to drive vital controls to ensure compliance with requirements. Senior level experience in harmonized tariff classification with local ruling review, and export licensing / permit applicability of computer, network and other hi-tech products.




This is your chance to work with the people who are leading the cloud revolution. You’ll bring fresh insight to projects that are changing lives around the world. To be successful in this role, you should have the ability to multitask and work independently and be able to provide solutions and operate as an excellent teammate.




As a Senior Trade Compliance Specialist, you will:

Analyzing and resolving complex customs compliance issues to make recommendations for compliant, practical solutions to management and internal business partners
Respond to all compliance inquiries from appointed import and export agents and customs brokers for assigned countries and regions
Perform customs declaration audits on Oracle customs declarations and handle remediation with customs brokers
Research and remain current on Thailand export regulations and eventual implementation of export licensing requirements
Resolve import and export licensing/permit applicability, submit online license applications, and arrange payments of export licenses for Thailand, upon regulation implementation if Internal Controls Program in Thai language is required
Assist in training Oracle Thailand employees and DHL on Thai export regulations
Indirect APAC country trade compliance due diligence
Support risk assessments from changes in business distribution model, manufacturing models, importer structure, and acquisitions
Pursue continuous process efficiencies, automation opportunities and documenting compliance procedures




Required Skills/Experience

What You’ll Bring

You have that rare combination—a sharp technical brain and a head for business. You’ll use this to help customers achieve real-world success with our products. We also look for:

Use your skills in interpreting customs regulations to assess applicability and impact to Oracle to drive vital controls to ensure compliance with requirements
Experienced in analyzing/resolving complex customs compliance issues to make recommendations for compliant, practical solutions and corrective action to management/internal business partners in specified countries and regions
Experienced in analyzing and implementation new customs and export control regulation requirements
Demonstrated experience representing company in meetings with customs officials to present customs compliance facts, applicable business structure, financial transactions, and support of Harmonized Tariff Classification import/exported product during either a regulatory audit and/or ad-hoc requests from customs authorities
Demonstrated experience in determination of import and export license/permit applicability for products within APAC region countries
Experienced in performing customs declaration auditing
Proven ability to meet deadlines
Experienced working in a multinational company with a global remote cross-functional team
Strong analytical skills, strong verbal, and written communication skills, in English and the local language of the placement
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Associate Degree and/or 5+ years of Customs compliance work experience
Preferred experience using Oracle ERP and Oracle Global Trade Management systems
Ability to travel up to 25%, when required

สมัคร
บันทึกAbout the job




Account Receivable

To be a Senior or Junior Account Receivable at Lazudi, you will be responsible for preparing invoices, handling Accounts Receivable, and collections, and maintaining accurate and up-to-date financial records. You will report to the Account Manager and work closely with the sales team to ensure timely payment collections. This full-time on-site role is in Bangkok City (Near BTS Thong Lor), Thailand.




Responsibilities




Responsible for the day-to-day financial transactions
Monitor and verify accounts receivable transactions to ensure that they are completed timely and accurately
Ensure timely accounts receivable collection
Ensure accounting documents (such as Credit note, Debit Note, Direct Tax Invoice, Withholding tax certificate, Dunning Letter, etc.) are issued timely and accurately according to policy.
Maintaining and reviewing financial records
Review all invoices for appropriate documentation, check invoices for inaccuracies
Contacting vendors via email or phone where necessary
Coordinate with external/internal parties as needed
Reconcile accounts with the general ledger
Support month-end and year-end close process
Manage and submit VAT and Withholding Tax [ PND1, PND3, PND53, PP30, PP36 ]
Handle accounting records for Accounts Receivable (AR), and General Ledger (GL).
Maintain and update accounting programs with accurate data and documents.
Conduct reconciliation of bank statements, general ledger entries, and other accounts.
Prepare audit reports and supplementary documentation, and assist with external audits.
Manage fixed assets and upkeep of the fixed assets register.
Collaborate with external agencies such as the Bank and the Revenue Department.
Performing administrative and clerical tasks, such as data entry, preparing invoices, sending bill reminders, filing paperwork, and contacting clients to discuss their accounts.
Undertake other reasonable duties as requested by the accountant and members of the Senior Leadership Team

Report to - Account Manager




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
2-3 years experience in a similar role in Accounts receivable.
Thorough knowledge of basic accounting procedures.
Good communication skills in both English and Thai.
Proficient in Excel, Word, Google Sheets, and G-Suit.
A highly responsible person who is results-oriented.
Able to work with International culture.
Excellent interpersonal skills, flexible and positive attitude, and a good team worker.
Experience with the real estate sector is a plus.

We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Customer & Channel Marketing Manager to drive trade marketing initiatives and build strong relationships with key customers in the region. This role is pivotal in ensuring the success of our products in the market by developing and executing effective channel and customer marketing strategies. The Channel and Customer Marketing manger should be able to understand shopper needs, Customer objectives and Category strategies to achieve a triple win for all. The role will directly report to GM for Southeast Asia. This role requires a strong background in Brand, Channel and Customer (Trade) marketing for distributors, modern trade customers, wholesalers, and retailers in the food industry. The ideal candidate is entrepreneurial and resourceful, with a proactive & goal-orientated mindset looking to break out from the status quo.

So, what does it take to be successful in this role?

You need to be able to develop and implement comprehensive channel and customer marketing strategies to achieve business objectives and sales targets.

Working Collaboratively with sales, marketing, supply chain & finance to create customer-specific marketing plans, tailored to meet the unique needs of each account.

Analyze market trends and consumer insights to identify growth opportunities and tailor marketing strategies accordingly.

Manage trade promotion budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources for maximum ROI.

Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers and partners, enhancing the company’s reputation and customer satisfaction.

Create compelling marketing materials, including POS displays, trade incentives, and sales collateral to support the sales team.

Monitor and evaluate the performance of trade marketing initiatives, providing recommendations for improvements.

Work closely with the sales team to ensure effective implementation of trade marketing strategies at the point of sale.

Stay updated on industry trends and competitor activities, providing insights to the leadership team.

What’s Next

If this position sounds interesting, please hit the apply button now! The deadline to apply is the 23rd November 2023. The first interview will take place on the 26th November 2023, the 2nd Interview will be on the first week of December and the final interview will be 3 days after.

We understand your resume might not be up to date and recommend that you apply with what you have or your LinkedIn Profile. Upfield is dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workplace, we understand that you might not meet all the requirements stated in the description, but we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the right candidate for this role or other roles. 

Upfield is an employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and equal opportunities for all. We recruit based only on values, qualifications, performance, skills, behaviours, experience, and knowledge. We ensure job advertisements are free from unintentional bias.

No personal characteristics should be a barrier to joining Upfield. We prohibit discrimination and harassment based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or other personal characteristics.

Country Operations Head
Asian Development Bank (ADB)  กรุงเทพมหานคร
5 ชั่วโมงก่อน   มาเป็นหนึ่งในผู้สมัคร 25 คนแรก
  
ดูบุคคลที่ Asian Development Bank (ADB) ได้ว่าจ้างสำหรับตำแหน่งนี้
สมัคร 
บันทึกOverview

Asian Development Bank (ADB) is an international development finance institution headquartered in Manila, Philippines and is composed of 68 members, 49 of which are from the Asia and Pacific region. ADB is committed to achieving a prosperous, inclusive, resilient, and sustainable Asia and the Pacific, while sustaining its efforts to eradicate extreme poverty. ADB combines finance, knowledge, and partnerships to fulfill its expanded vision under its Strategy 2030 .

ADB only hires nationals of its 68 members .

The position is assigned to the Thailand Resident Mission (TRM) within the Southeast Asia Department (SERD). SERD is responsible for maintaining client relations and delivering ADB assistance to countries in the Southeast Asian region. TRM is responsible for country partnership strategy, policy dialogue and client relationship, business development, program formulation, project processing and administration support, portfolio coordination, project quality assurance, economic work, knowledge management, and information dissemination in Thailand.

To view ADB Organizational Chart, please click here .

Job Purpose

The Country Operations Head will assist the Country Director in the sound management of operations in Thailand Resident Mission. The incumbent will coordinate country programming, business planning, quality assurance and portfolio monitoring and organize the provision of operations services to project teams. The incumbent will report to the Country Dire ctor with a matrix reporting to the Regional Head, Operations Coordination of the Southeast Asia Department and will supervise International, National and Administrative staff.

Responsibilities

Country portfolio management and programming


Leads the country portfolio performance review. Responsible for management, monitoring and reporting on sovereign and non-sovereign operations (programming, pipeline and portfolio management) at country level to achieve country KPIs. Provides high-level guidance on operational issues and compliance with ADB policies. Actively takes part in operations and portfolio networks, facilitated by Regional Head, Operations Coordination and PPFD.
Guides project teams on country-specific project and portfolio management issues and leads portfolio, programming and pipeline related missions and activities with government. Oversees project related communication and coordination with government and stakeholders. Consults with clients to swiftly resolve country-wide issues, and coordinates the resolution of project-specific issues, in collaboration with the solutions departments/offices.
Supports CD in assuring project/TA implementation arrangements are designed to meet country context. Guides sectors in the design and processing of projects to ensure that they are effectively delivered to advance ADB’s regional and country priorities, meet DMC needs, and fit the local context.
Oversees country programming including formulation, review and implementation of the country programs and the allocation of operational resources in the country in collaboration with Sectors Group, PSOD/OMDP and SEOC. Works closely with TRM’s programming team as well as country management team (CMT) members to develop an innovative, value-adding and ADB Thailand aligned thematic priorities (e.g. green finance and PSD) lending and TA projects’ pipeline including developing strategies, project pitches and relationships with relevant government counterparts.
Maintains pipelines and oversees progress of lending and non-lending by monitoring, supporting and facilitating the work of solutions departments for the timely delivery of the country program. Liaises with development partners on co-financing opportunities. Provides inputs into CPS and CPS reviews from a programming, pipeline and portfolio management perspective.
Advises the CD and backstops the quality of project-level documentation, concurrences and decisions for sovereign operations and technical assistance, as determined by SIs and PAIs. Liaises closely with Regional Head, Operations Coordination on all matters of quality assurance.
Serves as oversight for implementation of TRM’s stand-alone TAs as well as quality assurance focal point for RETAs being developed and implemented by relevant sector offices, ensuring that ADB’s strategic and cross-cutting concerns are appropriately addressed. Assists Country Director, TRM in staffing and office administration matters.


Work planning


Supports CD and the country management team in preparation of the Resident Mission’s work plan and alignment with regional department KPIs.
Serves as head of the secretariat to the country management team, supporting the country director to set standard operating procedures for its effective functioning.
Organizes and advises on the provision of certain operations services (e.g., safeguards, procurement, financial management) and thematic services (e.g., climate change, gender), to ensure adequate support to project teams delivering operations in the country.


Capacity development


Organizes and provides operational capacity development to staff and external clients on sovereign operations management.
Manages the performance of teams and individuals providing clear direction and regular monitoring and feedback on performance.
Provides coaching and mentoring to team and individuals and ensures their on-going learning and development.
Undertakes other activities as designated by CD and Regional Head, Operations Coordination. Coordinates with Regional Heads for Operations Coordination, Regional Head, Regional Cooperation and Integration, Lead Economist and Regional Head, Private Sector Development.


Relevant Experience & Requirements


Master's Degree, in engineering, finance, economics, business administration or related fields. University degree in engineering, finance, economics, business administration and related fields.
At least 12 years relevant professional experience in managing projects, portfolios and pipelines for development institutions. International experience working in development in several countries.
Proven management and leadership qualities.
Demonstrated cultural sensitivities and maturity.
Please refer to the link for ADB Competency Framework for Level 6.


General Considerations

The selected candidate, if new to ADB, is appointed for an initial term of 3 years.

ADB offers competitive remuneration and a comprehensive benefits package . Actual appointment salary will be based on ADB’s standards and computation, taking into account the selected individual’s qualifications and experience.

ADB seeks to ensure that everyone is treated with respect and given equal opportunities to work in an inclusive environment. ADB encourages all qualified candidates to apply regardless of their racial, ethnic, religious and cultural background, gender, sexual orientation or disabilities. Women are highly encouraged to apply.

Please note that the actual level and salary will be based on qualifications of the selected candidate.


Primary Location: Thailand Resident Mission-Thailand-Bangkok

Department: Southeast Asia Department

Staff Category: International Staff (HQ)

Position Level: IS 6

สมัคร
บันทึกAbout the Team

As part of Management Consulting’s market leading People & Organisation Consulting business, we help our clients in solving their most important and challenging business problems. Every day we challenge ourselves to do what matters most for our clients, our people and for the society. We offer the opportunity to be part of a firm that has the purpose of building trust in society and solving important problems, that gives you the opportunity to work with inspiring leaders and talented professionals to deliver outstanding value to our clients in a culture that is diverse, inclusive, collaborative and one that provides exceptional career experience.




Working within a high performing team and collaborating closely with other parts of PwC, you will be responsible for adding value to your client portfolio through the delivery of People & Organisation projects in the field of HR Transformation, Change Management, Leadership, Culture, Organisation Design, Workforce Transformation and People Analytics.




About the Role

Define, structure and implement improvements to the operation of the HR function and the overall impact and value that HR can drive for the business
Review HR processes, structure, technologies and use data & analytics to drive business alignment
Maximise organisational and HR performance and establish a culture focused on optimising business value
Assess, design and implement operating models aligned to the client’s strategic objectives
Drive change enablement for clients as part of large transformation programs
Manage teams to ensure on time, on budget delivery and achievement of outcomes
Support the sales cycle and help with practice development and eminence building
Support development of junior consultants by actively guiding them




About you

Demonstrate problem solving skills and the ability to work in complex and dynamic environments
Minimum 5 - 10 years of relevant experience within the human capital domain, including consulting experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience managing, coaching and mentoring junior team members
Ability to build and sustain client relationships
Collaboration and participation within a highly diverse and inclusive team
Ability to work independently and lead projects or large streams of work
Good subject matter knowledge across a range of HR/workforce-related capabilities such as HRT/change management/leadership/organisation design
Ability to multitask and prioritise workload with good working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
Good Thai and English communication skills
